33 template<typename Real>
34 void RandPosdefSpMatrix(MatrixIndexT dim, SpMatrix<Real> *matrix) {
35  MatrixIndexT dim2 = dim + (Rand() % 3); // slightly higher-dim.
36  // generate random (non-singular) matrix
37  Matrix<Real> tmp(dim, dim2);
38  while (1) {
39  tmp.SetRandn();
40  if (tmp.Cond() < 100) break;
41  KALDI_LOG << "Condition number of random matrix large "
42  << static_cast<float>(tmp.Cond())
43  << ", trying again (this is normal)";
44  }
45  // tmp * tmp^T will give positive definite matrix
46  matrix->AddMat2(1.0, tmp, kNoTrans, 0.0);
47 
48  // Checks that the matrix is indeed pos-def
49  TpMatrix<Real> sqrt(dim);
50  sqrt.Cholesky(*matrix);
51 }

73 template<typename Real> static void InitRand(MatrixBase<Real> *M) {
74 start:
75  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0;i < M->NumRows();i++)
76  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0;j < M->NumCols();j++)
77  (*M)(i, j) = RandGauss();
78  if (M->NumRows() != 0 && M->Cond() > 100) {
79  printf("Condition number of random matrix large %f, trying again (this is normal)\n",
80  (float) M->Cond());
81  goto start;
82  }
83 }

157 template<typename Real> static void CholeskyUnitTestTr() {
158  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
159  MatrixIndexT dimM = 2 + Rand() % 10;
160  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimM);
161  InitRand(&M);
162  SpMatrix<Real> S(dimM);
163  S.AddMat2(1.0, M, kNoTrans, 0.0);
164  TpMatrix<Real> C(dimM);
165  C.Cholesky(S);
166  Matrix<Real> CM(C);
167  TpMatrix<Real> Cinv(C);
168  Cinv.Invert();
169  {
170  Matrix<Real> A(C), B(Cinv), AB(dimM, dimM);
171  AB.AddMatMat(1.0, A, kNoTrans, B, kNoTrans, 0.0);
172  KALDI_ASSERT(AB.IsUnit());
173  }
174  SpMatrix<Real> S2(dimM);
175  S2.AddMat2(1.0, CM, kNoTrans, 0.0);
176  AssertEqual(S, S2);
177  C.Invert();
178  Matrix<Real> CM2(C);
179  CM2.Invert();
180  SpMatrix<Real> S3(dimM);
181  S3.AddMat2(1.0, CM2, kNoTrans, 0.0);
182  AssertEqual(S, S3);
183  }
184 }

207 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestAddDiagVecMat() {
208  for (int p = 0; p < 2; p++) {
209  MatrixIndexT dimM = 100 + Rand() % 255, dimN = 100 + Rand() % 255;
210  Real alpha = 0.43243, beta = 1.423;
211  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN), N(dimM, dimN);
212  M.SetRandn();
213  N.SetRandn();
214  MatrixTransposeType trans = (p % 2 == 0 ? kNoTrans : kTrans);
215  if (trans == kTrans)
216  N.Transpose();
217 
218  Vector<Real> V(dimM);
219  V.SetRandn();
220 
221  Matrix<Real> Mcheck(M);
222  for (int32 r = 0; r < dimM; r++) {
223  SubVector<Real> Mcheckrow(Mcheck, r);
224  Vector<Real> Nrow(dimN);
225  if (trans == kTrans) Nrow.CopyColFromMat(N, r);
226  else Nrow.CopyFromVec(N.Row(r));
227  Mcheckrow.Scale(beta);
228  Mcheckrow.AddVec(alpha * V(r), Nrow);
229  }
230 
231  M.AddDiagVecMat(alpha, V, N, trans, beta);
232  AssertEqual(M, Mcheck);
233  KALDI_ASSERT(M.Sum() != 0.0);
234  }
235 }

237 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestAddMatDiagVec() {
238  // M <- alpha * N[^T] * diag(v) + beta * M
239  for (int p = 0; p < 2; p++) {
240  MatrixIndexT dimM = 100 + Rand() % 255, dimN = 100 + Rand() % 255;
241  Real alpha = 0.43243, beta = 1.423;
242 
243  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN), N(dimM, dimN), buf(dimM, dimN);
244  M.SetRandn();
245  N.SetRandn();
246  buf.CopyFromMat(N);
247  MatrixTransposeType trans = (p % 2 == 0 ? kNoTrans : kTrans);
248  if (trans == kTrans)
249  N.Transpose();
250 
251  Vector<Real> V(dimN);
252  V.SetRandn();
253 
254  Matrix<Real> Mcheck(M);
255  Mcheck.Scale(beta);
256  buf.MulColsVec(V);
257  Mcheck.AddMat(alpha, buf, kNoTrans);
258 
259  M.AddMatDiagVec(alpha, N, trans, V, beta);
260  AssertEqual(M, Mcheck);
261  KALDI_ASSERT(M.Sum() != 0.0);
262  }
263 }

265 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestAddMatMatElements() {
266  // M <- alpha *(A .* B) + beta * M
267  MatrixIndexT dimM = 100 + Rand() % 255, dimN = 100 + Rand() % 255;
268  Real alpha = 0.43243, beta = 1.423;
269  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN), A(dimM, dimN), B(dimM, dimN), buf(dimM, dimN);
270  M.SetRandn();
271  A.SetRandn();
272  B.SetRandn();
273 
274  Matrix<Real> Mcheck(M);
275  buf.CopyFromMat(A); buf.MulElements(B);
276  Mcheck.Scale(beta); Mcheck.AddMat(alpha, buf, kNoTrans);
277 
278  M.AddMatMatElements(alpha, A, B, beta);
279  AssertEqual(M, Mcheck);
280  KALDI_ASSERT(M.Sum() != 0.0);
281 }

406 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestRemoveRow() {
407 
408  // this is for matrix
409  for (MatrixIndexT p = 0;p< 10;p++) {
410  MatrixIndexT dimM = 10+Rand()%10, dimN = 10+Rand()%10;
411  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN);
412  InitRand(&M);
413  MatrixIndexT i = Rand() % dimM; // Row to remove.
414  Matrix<Real> N(M);
415  N.RemoveRow(i);
416  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0;j < i;j++) {
417  for (MatrixIndexT k = 0;k < dimN;k++) {
418  KALDI_ASSERT(M(j, k) == N(j, k));
419  }
420  }
421  for (MatrixIndexT j = i+1;j < dimM;j++) {
422  for (MatrixIndexT k = 0;k < dimN;k++) {
423  KALDI_ASSERT(M(j, k) == N(j-1, k));
424  }
425  }
426  }
427 
428  // this is for vector
429  for (MatrixIndexT p = 0;p< 10;p++) {
430  MatrixIndexT dimM = 10+Rand()%10;
431  Vector<Real> V(dimM);
432  InitRand(&V);
433  MatrixIndexT i = Rand() % dimM; // Element to remove.
434  Vector<Real> N(V);
435  N.RemoveElement(i);
436  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0;j < i;j++) {
437  KALDI_ASSERT(V(j) == N(j));
438  }
439  for (MatrixIndexT j = i+1;j < dimM;j++) {
440  KALDI_ASSERT(V(j) == N(j-1));
441  }
442  }

460 // just need this for testing function below. Compute n!!
461 static int32 DoubleFactorial(int32 i) {
462  if (i <= 0) { return 1; } else { return i * DoubleFactorial(i - 2); }
463 }

465 template <typename Real>
466 static void UnitTestSetRandn() {
467  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
468  MatrixIndexT rows = 100 + Rand() % 50, cols = 100 + Rand() % 50;
469  Matrix<Real> M(rows, cols);
470  M.SetRandn();
471 
472  for (MatrixIndexT pow = 1; pow < 5; pow++) {
473  // test moments 1 through 4 of
474  // the distribution.
475  Matrix<Real> Mpow(M);
476  Mpow.ApplyPow(pow);
477  Real observed_moment = Mpow.Sum() / (rows * cols);
478  // see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normal_distribution#Moments,
479  // note that mu = 0 and sigma = 1.
480  Real expected_moment = (pow % 2 == 1 ? 0 : DoubleFactorial(pow - 1));
481  Real k = 10.0; // This is just a constant we use to give us some wiggle
482  // room before rejecting the distribution... e.g. 10 sigma,
483  // quite approximately.
484  Real allowed_deviation = k * pow / sqrt(static_cast<Real>(rows * cols));
485  // give it a bit more wiggle room for higher powers.. this is quite
486  // unscientific, it would be better to involve the absolute moments or
487  // something like that, and use one of those statistical inequalities,
488  // but it involves the gamma function and it's too much hassle to implement.
489  Real lower_bound = expected_moment - allowed_deviation,
490  upper_bound = expected_moment + allowed_deviation;
491  KALDI_ASSERT(observed_moment >= lower_bound && observed_moment <= upper_bound);
492  }
493  }
494 }

496 
497 template <typename Real>
498 static void UnitTestSetRandUniform() {
499  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
500  MatrixIndexT rows = 200 + Rand() % 50, cols = 200 + Rand() % 50;
501  Matrix<Real> M(rows, cols);
502  M.SetRandUniform();
503 
504  M.Add(-0.5); // we'll be testing the central moments, so
505  // center it around zero first.
506  // Got these moments from http://mathworld.wolfram.com/UniformDistribution.html
507  Vector<Real> central_moments(5);
508  central_moments(0) = 0.0;
509  central_moments(1) = 0.0;
510  central_moments(2) = 1.0 / 12; // times (b - a)^2, which equals 1.
511  central_moments(3) = 0.0;
512  central_moments(4) = 1.0 / 80; // times (b - a)^4, which equals 1.
513 
514  for (MatrixIndexT pow = 1; pow < central_moments.Dim(); pow++) {
515  Matrix<Real> Mpow(M);
516  Mpow.ApplyPow(pow);
517  Real observed_moment = Mpow.Sum() / (rows * cols);
518  // see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normal_distribution#Moments,
519  // note that mu = 0 and sigma = 1.
520  Real expected_moment = central_moments(pow);
521  Real k = 10.0; // This is just a constant we use to give us some wiggle
522  // room before rejecting the distribution... e.g. 10 sigma,
523  // quite approximately.
524  Real allowed_deviation = k / sqrt(static_cast<Real>(rows * cols));
525  Real lower_bound = expected_moment - allowed_deviation,
526  upper_bound = expected_moment + allowed_deviation;
527  KALDI_ASSERT(observed_moment >= lower_bound && observed_moment <= upper_bound);
528  }
529  }
530 }

533 template <typename Real>
534 static void UnitTestSimpleForVec() { // testing some simple operaters on vector
535 
536  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
537  Vector<Real> V(100), V1(100), V2(100), V3(100), V4(100);
538  InitRand(&V);
539  if (i % 2 == 0) {
540  V1.SetZero();
541  V1.Add(1.0);
542  } else {
543  V1.Set(1.0);
544  }
545 
546  V2.CopyFromVec(V);
547  V3.CopyFromVec(V1);
548  V2.InvertElements();
549  V3.DivElements(V);
550  V4.CopyFromVec(V3);
551  V4.AddVecDivVec(1.0, V1, V, 0.0);
552  AssertEqual(V3, V2);
553  AssertEqual(V4, V3);
554  V4.MulElements(V);
555  AssertEqual(V4, V1);
556  V3.AddVecVec(1.0, V, V2, 0.0);
557  AssertEqual(V3, V1);
558 
559  Vector<Real> V5(V), V6(V1), V7(V1), V8(V);
560  V5.AddVec(1.0, V);
561  V8.Scale(2.0);
562  V6.AddVec2(1.0, V);
563  V7.AddVecVec(1.0, V, V, 1.0);
564  AssertEqual(V6, V7);
565  AssertEqual(V5, V8);
566  }
567 
568  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
569  std::vector<MatrixIndexT> sizes;
570  sizes.push_back(16);
571  sizes.push_back(128);
572  for(int i = 0; i < sizes.size(); i++) {
573  MatrixIndexT dimM = sizes[i] + Rand() % 10, dimN = sizes[i] + Rand() % 10;
574  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN);
575  InitRand(&M);
576  Vector<Real> Vr(dimN), Vc(dimM);
577  Vr.AddRowSumMat(0.4, M);
578  Vr.AddRowSumMat(0.3, M, 0.5); // note: 0.3 + 0.4*0.5 = 0.5.
579  Vc.AddColSumMat(0.4, M);
580  Vc.AddColSumMat(0.3, M, 0.5); // note: 0.3 + 0.4*0.5 = 0.5.
581  Vr.Scale(2.0);
582  Vc.Scale(2.0);
583  KALDI_LOG << Vr;
584  KALDI_LOG << Vc;
585 
586  Vector<Real> V2r(dimN), V2c(dimM);
587  for (MatrixIndexT k = 0; k < dimM; k++) {
588  V2r.CopyRowFromMat(M, k);
589  AssertEqual(V2r.Sum(), Vc(k));
590  }
591  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j < dimN; j++) {
592  V2c.CopyColFromMat(M, j);
593  AssertEqual(V2c.Sum(), Vr(j));
594  }
595  }
596  }
597 
598  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
599  Vector<Real> V(100), V1(100), V2(100);
600  InitRand(&V);
601 
602  V1.CopyFromVec(V);
603  V1.ApplyExp();
604  Real a = V.LogSumExp();
605  V2.Set(Exp(V.LogSumExp()));
606  V1.DivElements(V2);
607  V2.CopyFromVec(V);
608 
609  Real b = V.ApplySoftMax();
610  AssertEqual(V1, V);
611  AssertEqual(a, b);
612 
613  V.ApplyLog();
614  Real c = V2.ApplyLogSoftMax();
615  AssertEqual(V2, V);
616  AssertEqual(a, c);
617  }
618 
619  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
620  MatrixIndexT dimV = 10 + Rand() % 10;
621  Real p = 0.5 + RandUniform() * 4.5;
622  Vector<Real> V(dimV), V1(dimV), V2(dimV);
623  InitRand(&V);
624  V1.AddVecVec(1.0, V, V, 0.0); // V1:=V.*V.
625  V2.CopyFromVec(V1);
626  AssertEqual(V1.Norm(p), V2.Norm(p));
627  AssertEqual(sqrt(V1.Sum()), V.Norm(2.0));
628  }
629 
630  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
631  MatrixIndexT dimV = 10 + Rand() % 10;
632  Real p = RandUniform() * 1.0e-5;
633  Vector<Real> V(dimV);
634  V.Set(p);
635  KALDI_ASSERT(V.IsZero(p));
636  KALDI_ASSERT(!V.IsZero(p*0.9));
637  }
638 
639  // Test ApplySoftMax() for matrix.
640  Matrix<Real> M(10, 10);
641  InitRand(&M);
642  M.ApplySoftMax();
643  KALDI_ASSERT( fabs(1.0 - M.Sum()) < 0.01);
644 
645 }

647 template<typename Real>

651  V.SetRandn();
652  Real m = V(0);

654  KALDI_ASSERT(m == V.Max());

673 template<typename Real>
674 static void UnitTestReplaceValue(){
675  // for vector

690 template<typename Real>
691 static void UnitTestNorm() { // test some simple norm properties: scaling. also ApproxEqual test.
692 
693  for (MatrixIndexT p = 0; p < 10; p++) {
694  Real scalar = RandGauss();
695  if (scalar == 0.0) continue;
696  if (scalar < 0) scalar *= -1.0;
697  MatrixIndexT dimM = 10 + Rand() % 10, dimN = 10 + Rand() % 10;
698  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN);
699  InitRand(&M);
700  SpMatrix<Real> S(dimM);
701  InitRand(&S);
702  Vector<Real> V(dimN);
703  InitRand(&V);
704 
705  Real Mnorm = M.FrobeniusNorm(),
706  Snorm = S.FrobeniusNorm(),
707  Vnorm1 = V.Norm(1.0),
708  Vnorm2 = V.Norm(2.0),
709  Vnorm3 = V.Norm(3.0);
710  M.Scale(scalar);
711  S.Scale(scalar);
712  V.Scale(scalar);
713  KALDI_ASSERT(ApproxEqual(M.FrobeniusNorm(), Mnorm*scalar));
714  KALDI_ASSERT(ApproxEqual(S.FrobeniusNorm(), Snorm*scalar));
715  KALDI_ASSERT(ApproxEqual(V.Norm(1.0), Vnorm1 * scalar));
716  KALDI_ASSERT(ApproxEqual(V.Norm(2.0), Vnorm2 * scalar));
717  KALDI_ASSERT(ApproxEqual(V.Norm(3.0), Vnorm3 * scalar));
718 
719  KALDI_ASSERT(V.ApproxEqual(V));
720  KALDI_ASSERT(M.ApproxEqual(M));
721  KALDI_ASSERT(S.ApproxEqual(S));
722  SpMatrix<Real> S2(S); S2.Scale(1.1); KALDI_ASSERT(!S.ApproxEqual(S2)); KALDI_ASSERT(S.ApproxEqual(S2, 0.15));
723  Matrix<Real> M2(M); M2.Scale(1.1); KALDI_ASSERT(!M.ApproxEqual(M2)); KALDI_ASSERT(M.ApproxEqual(M2, 0.15));
724  Vector<Real> V2(V); V2.Scale(1.1); KALDI_ASSERT(!V.ApproxEqual(V2)); KALDI_ASSERT(V.ApproxEqual(V2, 0.15));
725  }
726 }

729 template<typename Real>
730 static void UnitTestCopyRows() {
731  for (MatrixIndexT p = 0; p < 10; p++) {
732  MatrixIndexT num_rows1 = 10 + Rand() % 10,
733  num_rows2 = 10 + Rand() % 10,
734  num_cols = 10 + Rand() % 10;
735  Matrix<Real> M(num_rows1, num_cols);
736  InitRand(&M);
737 
738  Matrix<Real> N1(num_rows2, num_cols),
739  N2(num_rows2, num_cols), O(num_rows2, num_cols);
740  std::vector<int32> reorder(num_rows2);
741  std::vector<const Real*> reorder_src(num_rows2, NULL);
742  for (int32 i = 0; i < num_rows2; i++) {
743  reorder[i] = -1 + (Rand() % (num_rows1 + 1));
744  if (reorder[i] != -1)
745  reorder_src[i] = M.RowData(reorder[i]);
746  }
747 
748  N1.CopyRows(M, &(reorder[0]));
749  N2.CopyRows(&(reorder_src[0]));
750 
751  for (int32 i = 0; i < num_rows2; i++)
752  for (int32 j = 0; j < num_cols; j++)
753  if (reorder[i] < 0) O(i, j) = 0;
754  else O(i, j) = M(reorder[i], j);
755 
756  AssertEqual(N1, O);
757  AssertEqual(N2, O);
758  }
759 }

761 template<typename Real>
762 static void UnitTestCopyToRows() {
763  for (MatrixIndexT p = 0; p < 10; p++) {
764  MatrixIndexT num_rows1 = 10 + Rand() % 10,
765  num_rows2 = 10 + Rand() % 10,
766  num_cols = 10 + Rand() % 10;
767  Matrix<Real> M(num_rows1, num_cols);
768  InitRand(&M);
769 
770  Matrix<Real> N(num_rows2, num_cols), O(num_rows2, num_cols);
771  std::vector<Real*> reorder_dst(num_rows1, NULL);
772  unordered_map<MatrixIndexT, bool> used_index;
773  for (int32 i = 0; i < num_rows1; i++) {
774  MatrixIndexT index = -1 + (Rand() % (num_rows2 + 1));
775  if (used_index.find(index) == used_index.end()) {
776  used_index[index] = true;
777  } else {
778  index = -1;
779  }
780  if (index != -1) {
781  reorder_dst[i] = N.RowData(index);
782  for (int32 j = 0; j < num_cols; j++)
783  O(index, j) = M(i, j);
784  }
785  }
786 
787  M.CopyToRows(&(reorder_dst[0]));
788 
789  AssertEqual(N, O);
790  }
791 }

793 template<typename Real>
794 static void UnitTestAddRows() {
795  for (MatrixIndexT p = 0; p < 10; p++) {
796  MatrixIndexT num_rows1 = 10 + Rand() % 10,
797  num_rows2 = 10 + Rand() % 10,
798  num_cols = 10 + Rand() % 10;
799  Matrix<Real> M(num_rows1, num_cols);
800  InitRand(&M);
801 
802  Matrix<Real> N1(num_rows2, num_cols),
803  N2(num_rows2, num_cols), O(num_rows2, num_cols);
804  std::vector<int32> reorder(num_rows2);
805  std::vector<const Real*> reorder_src(num_rows2, NULL);
806  for (int32 i = 0; i < num_rows2; i++) {
807  reorder[i] = -1 + (Rand() % (num_rows1 + 1));
808  if (reorder[i] != -1)
809  reorder_src[i] = M.RowData(reorder[i]);
810  }
811 
812  Real alpha =
813  static_cast<Real>((Rand() % num_rows2)) / static_cast<Real>(num_rows1);
814 
815  N1.AddRows(alpha, M, &(reorder[0]));
816  N2.AddRows(alpha, &(reorder_src[0]));
817 
818  for (int32 i = 0; i < num_rows2; i++) {
819  if (reorder[i] != -1) {
820  for (int32 j = 0; j < num_cols; j++) {
821  O(i, j) += alpha * M(reorder[i], j);
822  }
823  }
824  }
825 
826  AssertEqual(N1, O);
827  AssertEqual(N2, O);
828  }
829 }

831 template<typename Real>
832 static void UnitTestAddToRows() {
833  for (MatrixIndexT p = 0; p < 10; p++) {
834  MatrixIndexT num_rows1 = 10 + Rand() % 10,
835  num_rows2 = 10 + Rand() % 10,
836  num_cols = 10 + Rand() % 10;
837  Matrix<Real> M(num_rows1, num_cols);
838  InitRand(&M);
839 
840  Real alpha =
841  static_cast<Real>((Rand() % num_rows2)) / static_cast<Real>(num_rows1);
842 
843  Matrix<Real> N(num_rows2, num_cols), O(num_rows2, num_cols);
844  std::vector<Real*> reorder_dst(num_rows1, NULL);
845  unordered_map<MatrixIndexT, bool> used_index;
846  for (int32 i = 0; i < num_rows1; i++) {
847  MatrixIndexT index = -1 + (Rand() % (num_rows2 + 1));
848  if (used_index.find(index) == used_index.end()) {
849  used_index[index] = true;
850  } else {
851  index = -1;
852  }
853  if (index != -1) {
854  reorder_dst[i] = N.RowData(index);
855  for (int32 j = 0; j < num_cols; j++)
856  O(index, j) += alpha * M(i, j);
857  }
858  }
859 
860  M.AddToRows(alpha, &(reorder_dst[0]));
861 
862  AssertEqual(N, O);
863  }

891 template<typename Real>
892 static void UnitTestSimpleForMat() { // test some simple operates on all kinds of matrix
893 
894  for (MatrixIndexT p = 0; p < 10; p++) {
895  // for FrobeniousNorm() function
896  MatrixIndexT dimM = 10 + Rand() % 10, dimN = 10 + Rand() % 10;
897  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN);
898  InitRand(&M);
899  {
900  Matrix<Real> N(M);
901  Real a = M.LogSumExp(), b = N.ApplySoftMax();
902  AssertEqual(a, b);
903  AssertEqual(1.0, N.Sum());
904  }
905  {
906  Matrix<Real> N(M);
907  N.Add(2.0);
908  for (MatrixIndexT m = 0; m < dimM; m++)
909  for (MatrixIndexT n = 0; n < dimN; n++)
910  N(m, n) -= 2.0;
911  AssertEqual(M, N);
912  }
913 
914  Matrix<Real> N(M), M1(M);
915  M1.MulElements(M);
916  Real tmp1 = sqrt(M1.Sum());
917  Real tmp2 = N.FrobeniusNorm();
918  KALDI_ASSERT(std::abs(tmp1 - tmp2) < 0.00001);
919 
920  // for LargestAbsElem() function
921  Vector<Real> V(dimM);
922  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < dimM; i++) {
923  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j < dimN; j++) {
924  M(i, j) = std::abs(M(i, j));
925  }
926  std::sort(M.RowData(i), M.RowData(i) + dimN);
927  V(i) = M(i, dimN - 1);
928  }
929  std::sort(V.Data(), V.Data() + dimM);
930  KALDI_ASSERT(std::abs(V(dimM - 1) - N.LargestAbsElem()) < 0.00001);
931  }
932 
933  SpMatrix<Real> x(3);
934  x.SetZero();
935 
936  std::stringstream ss;
937 
938  ss << "DP 3\n";
939  ss << "4.6863" << '\n';
940  ss << "3.7062 4.6032" << '\n';
941  ss << "3.4160 3.7256 5.2474" << '\n';
942 
943  ss >> x;
944  KALDI_ASSERT(x.IsPosDef() == true); // test IsPosDef() function
945 
946  TpMatrix<Real> y(3);
947  y.SetZero();
948  y.Cholesky(x);
949 
950 
951  // test sp-matrix's LogPosDefDet() function
952  Matrix<Real> B(x);
953  Real tmp;
954  Real *DetSign = &tmp;
955  KALDI_ASSERT(std::abs(B.LogDet(DetSign) - x.LogPosDefDet()) < 0.00001);
956 
957  for (MatrixIndexT p = 0; p < 10; p++) { // test for sp and tp matrix's AddSp() and AddTp() function
958  MatrixIndexT dimM = 10 + Rand() % 10;
959  SpMatrix<Real> S(dimM), S1(dimM);
960  TpMatrix<Real> T(dimM), T1(dimM);
961  InitRand(&S);
962  InitRand(&S1);
963  InitRand(&T);
964  InitRand(&T1);
965  Matrix<Real> M(S), M1(S1), N(T), N1(T1);
966 
967  S.AddSp(1.0, S1);
968  T.AddTp(1.0, T1);
969  M.AddMat(1.0, M1);
970  N.AddMat(1.0, N1);
971  Matrix<Real> S2(S);
972  Matrix<Real> T2(T);
973 
974  AssertEqual(S2, M);
975  AssertEqual(T2, N);
976  }
977 
978  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 10; i++) { // test for sp matrix's AddVec2() function
979  MatrixIndexT dimM = 10 + Rand() % 10;
980  SpMatrix<Real> M(dimM);
981  Vector<Real> V(dimM);
982 
983  InitRand(&M);
984  SpMatrix<double> Md(M);
985  InitRand(&V);
986  SpMatrix<Real> Sorig(M);
987  M.AddVec2(0.5, V);
988  Md.AddVec2(static_cast<Real>(0.5), V);
989  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < dimM; i++)
990  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j < dimM; j++) {
991  KALDI_ASSERT(std::abs(M(i, j) - (Sorig(i, j)+0.5*V(i)*V(j))) < 0.001);
992  KALDI_ASSERT(std::abs(Md(i, j) - (Sorig(i, j)+0.5*V(i)*V(j))) < 0.001);
993  }
994  }

1131 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestHeaviside() {
1132  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0;iter < 5;iter++) {
1133  MatrixIndexT dimM = 10 + Rand() % 10, dimN = 10 + Rand() % 10;
1134  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN), N(dimM, dimN);
1135  InitRand(&M);
1136  N = M;
1137  N.ApplyHeaviside();
1138  for (MatrixIndexT r = 0; r < dimM; r++) {
1139  for (MatrixIndexT c = 0; c < dimN; c++) {
1140  Real x = M(r, c), y = N(r, c);
1141  if (x < 0.0) KALDI_ASSERT(y == 0.0);
1142  if (x > 0.0) KALDI_ASSERT(y == 1.0);
1143  if (x == 0.0) { KALDI_ASSERT(y >= 0.0 && y <= 1.0); }
1144  }
1145  }
1146  }
1147 }

1195 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestDeterminant() { // also tests matrix axpy and IsZero() and TraceOfProduct{, T}
1196  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0;iter < 5;iter++) { // First test the 2 det routines are the same
1197  int dimM = 10 + Rand() % 10;
1198  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimM), N(dimM, dimM);
1199  InitRand(&M);
1200  N.AddMatMat(1.0, M, kNoTrans, M, kTrans, 0.0); // N:=M*M^T.
1201  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0;i < (MatrixIndexT)dimM;i++) N(i, i) += 0.0001; // Make sure numerically +ve det-- can by chance be almost singular the way we initialized it (I think)
1202  SpMatrix<Real> S(dimM);
1203  S.CopyFromMat(N); // symmetric so should not crash.
1204  Real logdet = S.LogPosDefDet();
1205  Real logdet2, logdet3, sign2, sign3;
1206  logdet2 = N.LogDet(&sign2);
1207  logdet3 = S.LogDet(&sign3);
1208  KALDI_ASSERT(sign2 == 1.0 && sign3 == 1.0 && std::abs(logdet2-logdet) < 0.1 && std::abs(logdet2 - logdet3) < 0.1);
1209  Matrix<Real> tmp(dimM, dimM); tmp.SetZero();
1210  tmp.AddMat(1.0, N);
1211  tmp.AddMat(-1.0, N, kTrans);
1212  // symmetric so tmp should be zero.
1213  if ( ! tmp.IsZero(1.0e-04)) {
1214  printf("KALDI_ERR: matrix is not zero\n");
1215  KALDI_LOG << tmp;
1216  KALDI_ASSERT(0);
1217  }
1218 
1219  Real a = TraceSpSp(S, S), b = TraceMatMat(N, N), c = TraceMatMat(N, N, kTrans);
1220  KALDI_ASSERT(std::abs(a-b) < 0.1 && std::abs(b-c) < 0.1);
1221  }
1222 }

1225 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestDeterminantSign() {
1226 
1227  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0;iter < 20;iter++) { // First test the 2 det routines are the same
1228  int dimM = 10 + Rand() % 10;
1229  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimM), N(dimM, dimM);
1230  InitRand(&M);
1231  N.AddMatMat(1.0, M, kNoTrans, M, kTrans, 0.0); // N:=M*M^T.
1232  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0;i < (MatrixIndexT)dimM;i++) N(i, i) += 0.0001; // Make sure numerically +ve det-- can by chance be almost singular the way we initialized it (I think)
1233  SpMatrix<Real> S(dimM);
1234  S.CopyFromMat(N); // symmetric so should not crash.
1235  Real logdet = S.LogPosDefDet();
1236  Real logdet2, logdet3, sign2, sign3;
1237  logdet2 = N.LogDet(&sign2);
1238  logdet3 = S.LogDet(&sign3);
1239  KALDI_ASSERT(sign2 == 1.0 && sign3 == 1.0 && std::abs(logdet2-logdet) < 0.01 && std::abs(logdet2 - logdet3) < 0.01);
1240 
1241  MatrixIndexT num_sign_changes = Rand() % 5;
1242  for (MatrixIndexT change = 0; change < num_sign_changes; change++) {
1243  // Change sign of S's det by flipping one eigenvalue, and N by flipping one row.
1244  {
1245  Matrix<Real> M(S);
1246  Matrix<Real> U(dimM, dimM), Vt(dimM, dimM);
1247  Vector<Real> s(dimM);
1248  M.Svd(&s, &U, &Vt); // SVD: M = U diag(s) Vt
1249  s(Rand() % dimM) *= -1;
1250  U.MulColsVec(s);
1251  M.AddMatMat(1.0, U, kNoTrans, Vt, kNoTrans, 0.0);
1252  S.CopyFromMat(M);
1253  }
1254  // change sign of N:
1255  N.Row(Rand() % dimM).Scale(-1.0);
1256  }
1257 
1258  // add in a scaling factor too.
1259  Real tmp = 1.0 + ((Rand() % 5) * 0.01);
1260  Real logdet_factor = dimM * Log(tmp);
1261  N.Scale(tmp);
1262  S.Scale(tmp);
1263 
1264  Real logdet4, logdet5, sign4, sign5;
1265  logdet4 = N.LogDet(&sign4);
1266  logdet5 = S.LogDet(&sign5);
1267  AssertEqual(logdet4, logdet+logdet_factor, 0.01);
1268  AssertEqual(logdet5, logdet+logdet_factor, 0.01);
1269  if (num_sign_changes % 2 == 0) {
1270  KALDI_ASSERT(sign4 == 1);
1271  KALDI_ASSERT(sign5 == 1);
1272  } else {
1273  KALDI_ASSERT(sign4 == -1);
1274  KALDI_ASSERT(sign5 == -1);
1275  }
1276  }
1277 }

1291 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestSherman() {
1292  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0;iter < 1;iter++) {
1293  MatrixIndexT dimM =10; // 20 + Rand()%10;
1294  MatrixIndexT dimK =2; // 20 + Rand()%dimM;
1295  Matrix<Real> A(dimM, dimM), U(dimM, dimK), V(dimM, dimK);
1296  InitRand(&A);
1297  InitRand(&U);
1298  InitRand(&V);
1299  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0;i < (MatrixIndexT)dimM;i++) A(i, i) += 0.0001; // Make sure numerically +ve det-- can by chance be almost singular the way we initialized it (I think)
1300 
1301  Matrix<Real> tmpL(dimM, dimM);
1302  tmpL.AddMatMat(1.0, U, kNoTrans, V, kTrans, 0.0); // tmpL =U *V.
1303  tmpL.AddMat(1.0, A);
1304  tmpL.Invert();
1305 
1306  Matrix<Real> invA(dimM, dimM);
1307  invA.CopyFromMat(A);
1308  invA.Invert();
1309 
1310  Matrix<Real> tt(dimK, dimM), I(dimK, dimK);
1311  tt.AddMatMat(1.0, V, kTrans, invA, kNoTrans, 0.0); // tt0 = trans(V) *inv(A)
1312 
1313  Matrix<Real> tt1(dimM, dimK);
1314  tt1.AddMatMat(1.0, invA, kNoTrans, U, kNoTrans, 0.0); // tt1=INV A *U
1315  Matrix<Real> tt2(dimK, dimK);
1316  tt2.AddMatMat(1.0, V, kTrans, tt1, kNoTrans, 0.0);
1317  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0;i < dimK;i++)
1318  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0;j < dimK;j++)
1319  {
1320  if (i == j)
1321  I(i, j) = 1.0;
1322  else
1323  I(i, j) = 0.0;
1324  }
1325  tt2.AddMat(1.0, I); // I = identity
1326  tt2.Invert();
1327 
1328  Matrix<Real> tt3(dimK, dimM);
1329  tt3.AddMatMat(1.0, tt2, kNoTrans, tt, kNoTrans, 0.0); // tt = tt*tran(V)
1330  Matrix<Real> tt4(dimM, dimM);
1331  tt4.AddMatMat(1.0, U, kNoTrans, tt3, kNoTrans, 0.0); // tt = U*tt
1332  Matrix<Real> tt5(dimM, dimM);
1333  tt5.AddMatMat(1.0, invA, kNoTrans, tt4, kNoTrans, 0.0); // tt = inv(A)*tt
1334 
1335  Matrix<Real> tmpR(dimM, dimM);
1336  tmpR.CopyFromMat(invA);
1337  tmpR.AddMat(-1.0, tt5);
1338  // printf("#################%f###############################.%f##############", tmpL, tmpR);
1339 
1340  AssertEqual<Real>(tmpL, tmpR); // checks whether LHS = RHS or not...
1341 
1342  }
1343 }

1502 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestEigSymmetric() {
1503 
1504  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0;iter < 5;iter++) {
1505  MatrixIndexT dimM = 20 + Rand()%10;
1506  SpMatrix<Real> S(dimM);
1507  InitRand(&S);
1508  Matrix<Real> M(S); // copy to regular matrix.
1509  Matrix<Real> P(dimM, dimM);
1510  Vector<Real> real_eigs(dimM), imag_eigs(dimM);
1511  M.Eig(&P, &real_eigs, &imag_eigs);
1512  KALDI_ASSERT(imag_eigs.Sum() == 0.0);
1513  // should have M = P D P^T
1514  Matrix<Real> tmp(P); tmp.MulColsVec(real_eigs); // P * eigs
1515  Matrix<Real> M2(dimM, dimM);
1516  M2.AddMatMat(1.0, tmp, kNoTrans, P, kTrans, 0.0); // M2 = tmp * Pinv = P * eigs * P^T
1517  AssertEqual(M, M2); // check reconstruction worked.
1518  }
1519 }

1521 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestEig() {
1522 
1523  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0;iter < 5;iter++) {
1524  MatrixIndexT dimM = 1 + iter;
1525  /* if (iter < 10)
1526  dimM = 1 + Rand() % 6;
1527  else
1528  dimM = 5 + Rand()%10; */
1529  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimM);
1530  InitRand(&M);
1531  Matrix<Real> P(dimM, dimM);
1532  Vector<Real> real_eigs(dimM), imag_eigs(dimM);
1533  M.Eig(&P, &real_eigs, &imag_eigs);
1534 
1535  { // Check that the eigenvalues match up with the determinant.
1536  BaseFloat logdet_check = 0.0, logdet = M.LogDet();
1537  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < dimM ; i++)
1538  logdet_check += 0.5 * Log(real_eigs(i)*real_eigs(i) + imag_eigs(i)*imag_eigs(i));
1539  AssertEqual(logdet_check, logdet);
1540  }
1541  Matrix<Real> Pinv(P);
1542  Pinv.Invert();
1543  Matrix<Real> D(dimM, dimM);
1544  CreateEigenvalueMatrix(real_eigs, imag_eigs, &D);
1545 
1546  // check that M = P D P^{-1}.
1547  Matrix<Real> tmp(dimM, dimM);
1548  tmp.AddMatMat(1.0, P, kNoTrans, D, kNoTrans, 0.0); // tmp = P * D
1549  Matrix<Real> M2(dimM, dimM);
1550  M2.AddMatMat(1.0, tmp, kNoTrans, Pinv, kNoTrans, 0.0); // M2 = tmp * Pinv = P * D * Pinv.
1551 
1552  { // print out some stuff..
1553  Matrix<Real> MP(dimM, dimM);
1554  MP.AddMatMat(1.0, M, kNoTrans, P, kNoTrans, 0.0);
1555  Matrix<Real> PD(dimM, dimM);
1556  PD.AddMatMat(1.0, P, kNoTrans, D, kNoTrans, 0.0);
1557 
1558  Matrix<Real> PinvMP(dimM, dimM);
1559  PinvMP.AddMatMat(1.0, Pinv, kNoTrans, MP, kNoTrans, 0.0);
1560  AssertEqual(MP, PD);
1561  }
1562 
1563  AssertEqual(M, M2); // check reconstruction worked.
1564  }
1565 }

1567 
1568 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestEigSp() {
1569  // Test the Eig function with SpMatrix.
1570  // We make sure to test pathological cases, that have
1571  // either large zero eigenspaces, or two large
1572  // eigenspaces with the same absolute value but +ve
1573  // and -ve. Also zero matrix.
1574 
1575  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0; iter < 100; iter++) {
1576  MatrixIndexT dimM = 1 + (Rand() % 10);
1577  SpMatrix<Real> S(dimM);
1578 
1579  switch (iter % 5) {
1580  case 0: // zero matrix.
1581  break;
1582  case 1: // general random symmetric matrix.
1583  InitRand(&S);
1584  break;
1585  default:
1586  { // start with a random matrix; do decomposition; change the eigenvalues to
1587  // try to cover the problematic cases; reconstruct.
1588  InitRand(&S);
1589  Vector<Real> s(dimM); Matrix<Real> P(dimM, dimM);
1590  S.Eig(&s, &P);
1591  // We on purpose create a problematic case where
1592  // some eigs are either zero or share a value (+ve or -ve)
1593  // with some other eigenvalue.
1594  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < dimM; i++) {
1595  if (Rand() % 10 == 0) s(i) = 0; // set that eig to zero.
1596  else if (Rand() % 10 < 2) {
1597  // set that eig to some other randomly chosen eig,
1598  // times random sign.
1599  s(i) = (Rand()%2 == 0 ? 1 : -1) * s(Rand() % dimM);
1600  }
1601  }
1602  // Reconstruct s from the eigenvalues "made problematic."
1603  S.AddMat2Vec(1.0, P, kNoTrans, s, 0.0);
1604  Real *data = s.Data();
1605  std::sort(data, data+dimM);
1606  KALDI_LOG << "Real eigs are: " << s;
1607 
1608  }
1609  }
1610  Vector<Real> s(dimM); Matrix<Real> P(dimM, dimM);
1611  S.Eig(&s, &P);
1612  KALDI_LOG << "Found eigs are: " << s;
1613  SpMatrix<Real> S2(dimM);
1614  S2.AddMat2Vec(1.0, P, kNoTrans, s, 0.0);
1615  {
1616  SpMatrix<Real> diff(S);
1617  diff.AddSp(-1.0, S2);
1618  Vector<Real> s(dimM); Matrix<Real> P(dimM, dimM);
1619  diff.Eig(&s, &P);
1620  KALDI_LOG << "Eigs of difference are " << s;
1621  }
1622  KALDI_ASSERT(S.ApproxEqual(S2, 1.0e-03f));
1623  }
1624 }
1625 
1626 // TEMP!
1627 template<typename Real>
1628 static Real NonOrthogonality(const MatrixBase<Real> &M, MatrixTransposeType transM) {
1629  SpMatrix<Real> S(transM == kTrans ? M.NumCols() : M.NumRows());
1630  S.SetUnit();
1631  S.AddMat2(-1.0, M, transM, 1.0);
1632  Real max = 0.0;
1633  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < S.NumRows(); i++)
1634  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j <= i; j++)
1635  max = std::max(max, std::abs(S(i, j)));
1636  return max;
1637 }
1638 
1639 template<typename Real>
1640 static Real NonDiagonalness(const SpMatrix<Real> &S) {
1641  Real max_diag = 0.0, max_offdiag = 0.0;
1642  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < S.NumRows(); i++)
1643  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
1644  if (i == j) { max_diag = std::max(max_diag, std::abs(S(i, j))); }
1645  else { max_offdiag = std::max(max_offdiag, std::abs(S(i, j))); }
1646  }
1647  if (max_diag == 0.0) {
1648  if (max_offdiag == 0.0) return 0.0; // perfectly diagonal.
1649  else return 1.0; // perfectly non-diagonal.
1650  } else {
1651  return max_offdiag / max_diag;
1652  }
1653 }
1654 
1655 
1656 template<typename Real>
1657 static Real NonUnitness(const SpMatrix<Real> &S) {
1658  SpMatrix<Real> tmp(S.NumRows());
1659  tmp.SetUnit();
1660  tmp.AddSp(-1.0, S);
1661  Real max = 0.0;
1662  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < tmp.NumRows(); i++)
1663  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j <= i; j++)
1664  max = std::max(max, std::abs(tmp(i, j)));
1665  return max;
1666 }

1668 template<typename Real>
1669 static void UnitTestTridiagonalize() {
1670 
1671  {
1672  float tmp[5];
1673  tmp[4] = 1.0;
1674  cblas_Xspmv(1, 0.0, tmp+2,
1675  tmp+1, 1, 0.0, tmp+4, 1);
1676  KALDI_ASSERT(tmp[4] == 0.0);
1677  }
1678  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
1679  MatrixIndexT dim = 40 + Rand() % 4;
1680  // We happened to find out that a 16x16 matrix of 27's causes problems for
1681  // Tridiagonalize.
1682  if (i == 0 || i == 1)
1683  dim = 16;
1684  SpMatrix<Real> S(dim), S2(dim), R(dim), S3(dim);
1685  Matrix<Real> Q(dim, dim);
1686  InitRand(&S);
1687  // Very small or large scaling is challenging to qr due to squares that
1688  // could go out of range.
1689  if (Rand() % 3 == 0)
1690  S.Scale(1.0e-15);
1691  else if (Rand() % 2 == 0)
1692  S.Scale(1.0e+15);
1693  if (i == 0 || i == 1) {
1694  Matrix<Real> temp(dim, dim);
1695  if (i == 0)
1696  temp.Set(27.0);
1697  else
1698  temp.Set(-1.61558713e-27);
1699  S.CopyFromMat(temp);
1700  }
1701  SpMatrix<Real> T(S);
1702  T.Tridiagonalize(&Q);
1703  KALDI_LOG << "S trace " << S.Trace() << ", T trace " << T.Trace();
1704  // KALDI_LOG << S << "\n" << T;
1705  AssertEqual(S.Trace(), T.Trace());
1706  // Also test Trace().
1707  Real ans = 0.0;
1708  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j < dim; j++) ans += T(j, j);
1709  AssertEqual(ans, T.Trace());
1710  if (S.LogDet() > -50.0) {
1711  // don't check logdet equality if original logdet is very negative- could
1712  // be singular.
1713  AssertEqual(T.LogDet(), S.LogDet());
1714  }
1715  R.AddMat2(1.0, Q, kNoTrans, 0.0);
1716  KALDI_LOG << "Non-unit-ness of R is " << NonUnitness(R);
1717  KALDI_ASSERT(R.IsUnit(0.01)); // Check Q is orthogonal.
1718  S2.AddMat2Sp(1.0, Q, kTrans, T, 0.0);
1719  S3.AddMat2Sp(1.0, Q, kNoTrans, S, 0.0);
1720  //KALDI_LOG << "T is " << T;
1721  //KALDI_LOG << "S is " << S;
1722  //KALDI_LOG << "S2 (should be like S) is " << S2;
1723  //KALDI_LOG << "S3 (should be like T) is " << S3;
1724  AssertEqual(S, S2);
1725  AssertEqual(T, S3);
1726  }
1727 }

1729 template<typename Real>
1730 static void UnitTestTridiagonalizeAndQr() {
1731 
1732  {
1733  float tmp[5];
1734  tmp[4] = 1.0;
1735  // cblas_sspmv(CblasRowMajor, CblasLower, 1, 0.0, tmp+2,
1736  // tmp+1, 1, 0.0, tmp+4, 1);
1737  cblas_Xspmv(1, 0.0, tmp+2,
1738  tmp+1, 1, 0.0, tmp+4, 1);
1739 
1740  KALDI_ASSERT(tmp[4] == 0.0);
1741  }
1742  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
1743  MatrixIndexT dim = 50 + Rand() % 4;
1744  SpMatrix<Real> S(dim), S2(dim), R(dim), S3(dim), S4(dim);
1745  Matrix<Real> Q(dim, dim);
1746  InitRand(&S);
1747  SpMatrix<Real> T(S);
1748  T.Tridiagonalize(&Q);
1749  KALDI_LOG << "S trace " << S.Trace() << ", T trace " << T.Trace();
1750  // KALDI_LOG << S << "\n" << T;
1751  AssertEqual(S.Trace(), T.Trace());
1752  // Also test Trace().
1753  Real ans = 0.0;
1754  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j < dim; j++) ans += T(j, j);
1755  AssertEqual(ans, T.Trace());
1756  AssertEqual(T.LogDet(), S.LogDet());
1757  R.AddMat2(1.0, Q, kNoTrans, 0.0);
1758  KALDI_LOG << "Non-unit-ness of R after tridiag is " << NonUnitness(R);
1759  KALDI_ASSERT(R.IsUnit(0.001)); // Check Q is orthogonal.
1760  S2.AddMat2Sp(1.0, Q, kTrans, T, 0.0);
1761  S3.AddMat2Sp(1.0, Q, kNoTrans, S, 0.0);
1762  //KALDI_LOG << "T is " << T;
1763  //KALDI_LOG << "S is " << S;
1764  //KALDI_LOG << "S2 (should be like S) is " << S2;
1765  //KALDI_LOG << "S3 (should be like T) is " << S3;
1766  AssertEqual(S, S2);
1767  AssertEqual(T, S3);
1768  SpMatrix<Real> T2(T);
1769  T2.Qr(&Q);
1770  R.AddMat2(1.0, Q, kNoTrans, 0.0);
1771  KALDI_LOG << "Non-unit-ness of R after QR is " << NonUnitness(R);
1772  KALDI_ASSERT(R.IsUnit(0.001)); // Check Q is orthogonal.
1773  AssertEqual(T.Trace(), T2.Trace());
1774  KALDI_ASSERT(T2.IsDiagonal());
1775  AssertEqual(T.LogDet(), T2.LogDet());
1776  S4.AddMat2Sp(1.0, Q, kTrans, T2, 0.0);
1777  //KALDI_LOG << "S4 (should be like S) is " << S4;
1778  AssertEqual(S, S4);
1779  }
1780 }

1858 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestVecmul() {
1859  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0;iter < 5;iter++) {
1860  MatrixTransposeType trans = (iter % 2 == 0 ? kTrans : kNoTrans);
1861  MatrixIndexT dimM = 20 + Rand()%10, dimN = 20 + Rand()%10; // dims between 10 and 20.
1862  Real alpha = 0.333, beta = 0.5;
1863  Matrix<Real> A(dimM, dimN);
1864  if (trans == kTrans) A.Transpose();
1865  InitRand(&A);
1866  Vector<Real> x(dimM), y(dimN);
1867  //x.SetRandn();
1868  y.SetRandn();
1869  Vector<Real> orig_x(x), x2(x);
1870 
1871  x.AddMatVec(alpha, A, trans, y, beta); // x = A * y + beta*x.
1872  x2.AddMatSvec(alpha, A, trans, y, beta); // x = A * y + beta*x
1873 
1874  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < dimM; i++) {
1875  double sum = beta * orig_x(i);
1876  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j < dimN; j++) {
1877  if (trans == kNoTrans) {
1878  sum += alpha * A(i, j) * y(j);
1879  } else {
1880  sum += alpha * A(j, i) * y(j);
1881  }
1882  }
1883  KALDI_ASSERT(std::abs(sum - x(i)) < 0.0001);
1884  }
1885  AssertEqual(x, x2);
1886  }
1887 
1888 }

1969 template<typename Real>
1970 static void UnitTestResize() {
1971  for (size_t i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
1972  MatrixIndexT dimM1 = Rand() % 10, dimN1 = Rand() % 10,
1973  dimM2 = Rand() % 10, dimN2 = Rand() % 10;
1974  if (dimM1*dimN1 == 0) dimM1 = dimN1 = 0;
1975  if (dimM2*dimN2 == 0) dimM2 = dimN2 = 0;
1976  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
1977  MatrixResizeType resize_type = static_cast<MatrixResizeType>(j);
1978  Matrix<Real> M(dimM1, dimN1);
1979  InitRand(&M);
1980  Matrix<Real> Mcopy(M);
1981  Vector<Real> v(dimM1);
1982  InitRand(&v);
1983  Vector<Real> vcopy(v);
1984  SpMatrix<Real> S(dimM1);
1985  InitRand(&S);
1986  SpMatrix<Real> Scopy(S);
1987  M.Resize(dimM2, dimN2, resize_type);
1988  v.Resize(dimM2, resize_type);
1989  S.Resize(dimM2, resize_type);
1990  if (resize_type == kSetZero) {
1991  KALDI_ASSERT(S.IsZero());
1992  KALDI_ASSERT(v.Sum() == 0.0);
1993  KALDI_ASSERT(M.IsZero());
1994  } else if (resize_type == kCopyData) {
1995  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < dimM2; i++) {
1996  if (i < dimM1) AssertEqual(v(i), vcopy(i));
1997  else KALDI_ASSERT(v(i) == 0);
1998  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j < dimN2; j++) {
1999  if (i < dimM1 && j < dimN1) AssertEqual(M(i, j), Mcopy(i, j));
2000  else AssertEqual(M(i, j), 0.0);
2001  }
2002  for (MatrixIndexT i2 = 0; i2 < dimM2; i2++) {
2003  if (i < dimM1 && i2 < dimM1) AssertEqual(S(i, i2), Scopy(i, i2));
2004  else AssertEqual(S(i, i2), 0.0);
2005  }
2006  }
2007  }
2008  }
2009  }
2010 }

2122 template<typename Real>
2123 static void UnitTestOrthogonalizeRows() {
2124  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0; iter < 100; iter++) {
2125  MatrixIndexT dimM = 4 + Rand() % 5, dimN = dimM + (Rand() % 2);
2126  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN);
2127  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < dimM; i++) {
2128  if (Rand() % 5 != 0) M.Row(i).SetRandn();
2129  }
2130  if (Rand() % 2 != 0) { // Multiply by a random square matrix;
2131  // keeps it low rank but will be correlated. Harder
2132  // test case.
2133  Matrix<Real> N(dimM, dimM);
2134  N.SetRandn();
2135  Matrix<Real> tmp(dimM, dimN);
2136  tmp.AddMatMat(1.0, N, kNoTrans, M, kNoTrans, 0.0);
2137  M.CopyFromMat(tmp);
2138  }
2139  M.OrthogonalizeRows();
2140  Matrix<Real> I(dimM, dimM);

2293 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestFloorChol() {
2294  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0;i < 10;i++) {
2295  MatrixIndexT dimM = 20 + Rand()%10;
2296 
2297 
2298  MatrixIndexT dimN = 20 + Rand()%10;
2299  Matrix<Real> X(dimM, dimN); InitRand(&X);
2300  SpMatrix<Real> B(dimM);
2301  B.AddMat2(1.0, X, kNoTrans, 0.0); // B = X*X^T -> positive semidefinite.
2302 
2303  float alpha = (Rand() % 10) + 0.5;
2304  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimM);
2305  InitRand(&M);
2306  SpMatrix<Real> C(dimM);
2307  C.AddMat2(1.0, M, kNoTrans, 0.0); // C:=M*M^T
2308  InitRand(&M);
2309  C.AddMat2(1.0, M, kNoTrans, 1.0); // C+=M*M^T (after making new random M)
2310  if (i%2 == 0)
2311  C.Scale(0.001); // so it's not too much bigger than B (or it's trivial)
2312  SpMatrix<Real> BFloored(B); BFloored.ApplyFloor(C, alpha);
2313 
2314 
2315  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0;j < 10;j++) {
2316  Vector<Real> v(dimM);
2317  InitRand(&v);
2318  Real ip_b = VecSpVec(v, B, v);
2319  Real ip_a = VecSpVec(v, BFloored, v);
2320  Real ip_c = alpha * VecSpVec(v, C, v);
2321  if (i < 3) KALDI_LOG << "alpha = " << alpha << ", ip_a = " << ip_a << " ip_b = " << ip_b << " ip_c = " << ip_c <<'\n';
2322  KALDI_ASSERT(ip_a>=ip_b*0.999 && ip_a>=ip_c*0.999);
2323  }
2324  }
2325 }

2351 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestFloorCeiling() {

2353  MatrixIndexT dimM = 10 + Rand() % 10;
2354  Vector<Real> v(dimM);
2355  v.SetRandn();

2358  MatrixIndexT floored2 = f.ApplyFloor(pivot),
2359  ceiled2 = c.ApplyCeiling(pivot);
2360  MatrixIndexT floored = 0, ceiled = 0;
2361  for (MatrixIndexT d = 0; d < dimM; d++) {
2362  if (f2(d) < pivot) { f2(d) = pivot; floored++; }
2363  if (c2(d) > pivot) { c2(d) = pivot; ceiled++; }
2364  }
2365  AssertEqual(f, f2);
2366  AssertEqual(c, c2);
2367  KALDI_ASSERT(floored == floored2);
2368  KALDI_ASSERT(ceiled == ceiled2);

2410 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestTanh() {
2411  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
2412  MatrixIndexT dimM = 5 + Rand() % 10, dimN = 5 + Rand() % 10;
2413  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN), P(dimM, dimN), Q(dimM, dimN), R(dimM, dimN);
2414  M.SetRandn();
2415  P.SetRandn();
2416  Matrix<Real> N(M);
2417  for(int32 r = 0; r < dimM; r++) {
2418  for (int32 c = 0; c < dimN; c++) {
2419  Real x = N(r, c);
2420  if (x > 0.0) {
2421  x = -1.0 + 2.0 / (1.0 + Exp(-2.0 * x));
2422  } else {
2423  x = 1.0 - 2.0 / (1.0 + Exp(2.0 * x));
2424  }
2425  N(r, c) = x;
2426  Real out_diff = P(r, c), in_diff = out_diff * (1.0 - x * x);
2427  Q(r, c) = in_diff;
2428  }
2429  }
2430  M.Tanh(M);
2431  R.DiffTanh(N, P);
2432  AssertEqual(M, N);
2433  AssertEqual(Q, R);
2434  }
2435 }

2481 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestSimple() {
2482  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0;i < 5;i++) {
2483  MatrixIndexT dimM = 20 + Rand()%10, dimN = 20 + Rand()%20;
2484  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN);
2485  M.SetUnit();
2486  KALDI_ASSERT(M.IsUnit());
2487  KALDI_ASSERT(!M.IsZero());
2488  KALDI_ASSERT(M.IsDiagonal());
2489 
2490  SpMatrix<Real> S(dimM); InitRand(&S);
2491  Matrix<Real> N(S);
2492  KALDI_ASSERT(!N.IsDiagonal()); // technically could be diagonal, but almost infinitely unlikely.
2493  KALDI_ASSERT(N.IsSymmetric());
2494  KALDI_ASSERT(!N.IsUnit());
2495  KALDI_ASSERT(!N.IsZero());
2496 
2497  M.SetZero();
2498  KALDI_ASSERT(M.IsZero());
2499  Vector<Real> V(dimM*dimN); InitRand(&V);
2500  Vector<Real> V2(V), V3(dimM*dimN);
2501  V2.ApplyExp();
2502  AssertEqual(V.Sum(), V2.SumLog());
2503  V3.ApplyLogAndCopy(V2);
2504  V2.ApplyLog();
2505  AssertEqual(V, V2);
2506  AssertEqual(V3, V2);
2507 
2508  {
2509  Vector<Real> V2(V);
2510  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < V2.Dim(); i++)
2511  V2(i) = Exp(V2(i));
2512  V.ApplyExp();
2513  AssertEqual(V, V2);
2514  }
2515  {
2516  Matrix<Real> N2(N), N3(N);
2517  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < N.NumRows(); i++)
2518  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j < N.NumCols(); j++)
2519  N2(i, j) = Exp(N2(i, j));
2520  N3.ApplyExp();
2521  AssertEqual(N2, N3);
2522  }
2523  KALDI_ASSERT(!S.IsDiagonal());
2524  KALDI_ASSERT(!S.IsUnit());
2525  N.SetUnit();
2526  S.CopyFromMat(N);
2527  KALDI_ASSERT(S.IsDiagonal());
2528  KALDI_ASSERT(S.IsUnit());
2529  N.SetZero();
2530  S.CopyFromMat(N);
2531  KALDI_ASSERT(S.IsZero());
2532  KALDI_ASSERT(S.IsDiagonal());
2533  }

2662 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestHtkIo() {

2666  MatrixIndexT dimN = Rand()%10 + 10;
2667

2682  Matrix<Real> N;
2683  HtkHeader hdr2;
2684  {
2685  std::ifstream is("tmpf", std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
2686  ReadHtk(is, &N, &hdr2);
2687  }
2688 
2689  AssertEqual(M, N);
2690  KALDI_ASSERT(hdr.mNSamples == hdr2.mNSamples);
2691  KALDI_ASSERT(hdr.mSamplePeriod == hdr2.mSamplePeriod);
2692  KALDI_ASSERT(hdr.mSampleSize == hdr2.mSampleSize);
2693  KALDI_ASSERT(hdr.mSampleKind == hdr2.mSampleKind);
2694  }
2695 
2696  unlink("tmpf");
2697 }

2701 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestRange() { // Testing SubMatrix class.

2705  MatrixIndexT dimM = (Rand()%10) + 10;
2706  MatrixIndexT dimN = (Rand()%10) + 10;
2707

2710  MatrixIndexT dimMStart = Rand() % 5;
2711  MatrixIndexT dimNStart = Rand() % 5;
2712

2714  MatrixIndexT dimNEnd = dimNStart + 1 + (Rand()%10); if (dimNEnd > dimN) dimNEnd = dimN;
2715 
2716

2718

2720

2722  for (MatrixIndexT j = dimNStart;j < dimNEnd;j++)
2723  KALDI_ASSERT(M(i, j) == sub(i-dimMStart, j-dimNStart));
2724 
2725  InitRand(&sub);
2726 
2727  KALDI_ASSERT(sub.Sum() == M.Range(dimMStart, dimMEnd-dimMStart, dimNStart, dimNEnd-dimNStart).Sum());
2728 
2729  for (MatrixIndexT i = dimMStart;i < dimMEnd;i++)
2730  for (MatrixIndexT j = dimNStart;j < dimNEnd;j++)
2731  KALDI_ASSERT(M(i, j) == sub(i-dimMStart, j-dimNStart));
2732  }
2733 
2734  // this if for vector-range

2749  KALDI_ASSERT(V(i) == sub(i-lenStart));
2750

3048 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestSolve() {
3049 
3050  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0;i < 5;i++) {
3051  MatrixIndexT dimM = (Rand()%10) + 10;
3052  MatrixIndexT dimN = dimM - (Rand()%3); // slightly lower-dim.
3053 
3054  SpMatrix<Real> H(dimM);
3055  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN); InitRand(&M);
3056  H.AddMat2(1.0, M, kNoTrans, 0.0); // H = M M^T
3057 
3058  Vector<Real> x(dimM);
3059  InitRand(&x);
3060  Vector<Real> tmp(dimM);
3061  tmp.SetRandn();
3062  Vector<Real> g(dimM);
3063  g.AddSpVec(1.0, H, tmp, 0.0); // Limit to subspace that H is in.
3064  Vector<Real> x2(x), x3(x);
3065  SolverOptions opts2, opts3;
3066  opts2.diagonal_precondition = Rand() % 2;
3067  opts2.optimize_delta = Rand() % 2;
3068  opts3.diagonal_precondition = Rand() % 2;
3069  opts3.optimize_delta = Rand() % 2;
3070 
3071  double ans2 = SolveQuadraticProblem(H, g, opts2, &x2),
3072  ans3 = SolveQuadraticProblem(H, g, opts3, &x3);
3073 
3074  double observed_impr2 = (VecVec(x2, g) -0.5* VecSpVec(x2, H, x2)) -
3075  (VecVec(x, g) -0.5* VecSpVec(x, H, x)),
3076  observed_impr3 = (VecVec(x3, g) -0.5* VecSpVec(x3, H, x3)) -
3077  (VecVec(x, g) -0.5* VecSpVec(x, H, x));
3078  AssertEqual(observed_impr2, ans2);
3079  AssertEqual(observed_impr3, ans3);
3080  KALDI_ASSERT(ans2 >= 0);
3081  KALDI_ASSERT(ans3 >= 0);
3082  KALDI_ASSERT(std::abs(ans2 - ans3) / std::max(ans2, ans3) < 0.01);
3083  //AssertEqual(x2, x3);
3084  //AssertEqual(ans1, ans2);
3085  }
3086 
3087 
3088  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
3089  MatrixIndexT dimM = (Rand() % 10) + 10;
3090  MatrixIndexT dimN = dimM - (Rand() % 3); // slightly lower-dim.
3091  MatrixIndexT dimO = (Rand() % 10) + 10;
3092 
3093  SpMatrix<Real> Q(dimM), SigmaInv(dimO);
3094  Matrix<Real> Mtmp(dimM, dimN);
3095  InitRand(&Mtmp);
3096  Q.AddMat2(1.0, Mtmp, kNoTrans, 0.0); // H = M M^T
3097 
3098  Matrix<Real> Ntmp(dimO, dimN);
3099  InitRand(&Ntmp);
3100  SigmaInv.AddMat2(1.0, Ntmp, kNoTrans, 0.0); // H = M M^T
3101 
3102  Matrix<Real> M(dimO, dimM), Y(dimO, dimM);
3103  InitRand(&M);
3104  InitRand(&Y);
3105 
3106  Matrix<Real> M2(M);
3107 
3108  SpMatrix<Real> Qinv(Q);
3109  if (Q.Cond() < 1000.0) Qinv.Invert();
3110 
3111  SolverOptions opts;
3112  opts.optimize_delta = Rand() % 2;
3113  opts.diagonal_precondition = Rand() % 2;
3114  double ans = SolveQuadraticMatrixProblem(Q, Y, SigmaInv, opts, &M2);
3115 
3116  Matrix<Real> M3(M);
3117  M3.AddMatSp(1.0, Y, kNoTrans, Qinv, 0.0);
3118  if (Q.Cond() < 1000.0) {
3119  AssertEqual(M2, M3); // This equality only holds if SigmaInv full-rank,
3120  // which is overwhelmingly likely if dimO > dimM
3121  }
3122 
3123  {
3124  Real a1 = TraceMatSpMat(M2, kTrans, SigmaInv, Y, kNoTrans),
3125  a2 = TraceMatSpMatSp(M2, kNoTrans, Q, M2, kTrans, SigmaInv),
3126  b1 = TraceMatSpMat(M, kTrans, SigmaInv, Y, kNoTrans),
3127  b2 = TraceMatSpMatSp(M, kNoTrans, Q, M, kTrans, SigmaInv),
3128  a3 = a1 - 0.5 * a2,
3129  b3 = b1 - 0.5 * b2;
3130  KALDI_ASSERT(a3 >= b3);
3131  AssertEqual(a3 - b3, ans);
3132  // KALDI_LOG << "a3 = " << a3 << ", b3 = " << b3 << ", c3 = " << c3;
3133  } // Check objf not decreased.
3134  }
3135 
3136  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
3137  MatrixIndexT dimM = (Rand() % 10) + 10;
3138  MatrixIndexT dimO = (Rand() % 10) + 10;
3139 
3140  SpMatrix<Real> Q1(dimM), Q2(dimM), P1(dimO), P2(dimO);
3141  RandPosdefSpMatrix(dimM, &Q1);
3142  RandPosdefSpMatrix(dimM, &Q2);
3143  RandPosdefSpMatrix(dimO, &P1);
3144  RandPosdefSpMatrix(dimO, &P1);
3145 
3146  Matrix<Real> M(dimO, dimM), G(dimO, dimM);
3147  M.SetRandn();
3148  G.SetRandn();
3149  // InitRand(&M);
3150  // InitRand(&G);
3151 
3152  Matrix<Real> M2(M);
3153 
3154  SolverOptions opts;
3155  opts.optimize_delta = Rand() % 2;
3156  SolveDoubleQuadraticMatrixProblem(G, P1, P2, Q1, Q2, opts, &M2);
3157 
3158  {
3159  Real a1 = TraceMatMat(M2, G, kTrans),
3160  a2 = TraceMatSpMatSp(M2, kNoTrans, Q1, M2, kTrans, P1),
3161  a3 = TraceMatSpMatSp(M2, kNoTrans, Q2, M2, kTrans, P2),
3162  b1 = TraceMatMat(M, G, kTrans),
3163  b2 = TraceMatSpMatSp(M, kNoTrans, Q1, M, kTrans, P1),
3164  b3 = TraceMatSpMatSp(M, kNoTrans, Q2, M, kTrans, P2),
3165  a4 = a1 - 0.5 * a2 - 0.5 * a3,
3166  b4 = b1 - 0.5 * b2 - 0.5 * b3;
3167  KALDI_LOG << "a4 = " << a4 << ", b4 = " << b4;
3168  KALDI_ASSERT(a4 >= b4);
3169  } // Check objf not decreased.
3170  }

3200 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestLbfgs() {
3201  MatrixIndexT temp = g_kaldi_verbose_level;
3202  g_kaldi_verbose_level = 4;
3203  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0; iter < 3; iter++) {
3204  bool minimize = (iter % 2 == 0);
3205  MatrixIndexT dim = 1 + Rand() % 30;
3206  SpMatrix<Real> S(dim);
3207  RandPosdefSpMatrix(dim, &S);
3208  Vector<Real> v(dim);
3209  InitRand(&v);
3210  // Function will be f = exp(0.1 * [ x' v -0.5 x' S x ])
3211  // This is to maximize; we negate it when minimizing.
3212 
3213  //Vector<Real> hessian(dim);
3214  //hessian.CopyDiagFromSp(S);
3215 
3216  SpMatrix<Real> Sinv(S);
3217  Sinv.Invert();
3218  Vector<Real> x_opt(dim);
3219  x_opt.AddSpVec(1.0, Sinv, v, 0.0); // S^{-1} v-- the optimum.
3220 
3221  Vector<Real> init_x(dim);
3222  InitRand(&init_x);
3223 
3224  LbfgsOptions opts;
3225  opts.minimize = minimize; // This objf has a maximum, not a minimum.
3226  OptimizeLbfgs<Real> opt_lbfgs(init_x, opts);
3227  MatrixIndexT num_iters = 0;
3228  Real c = 0.01;
3229  Real sign = (minimize ? -1.0 : 1.0); // function has a maximum not minimum..
3230  while (opt_lbfgs.RecentStepLength() > 1.0e-04) {
3231  KALDI_VLOG(2) << "Last step length is " << opt_lbfgs.RecentStepLength();
3232  const VectorBase<Real> &x = opt_lbfgs.GetProposedValue();
3233  Real logf = VecVec(x, v) - 0.5 * VecSpVec(x, S, x);
3234  Vector<Real> dlogf_dx(v); // derivative of log(f) w.r.t. x.
3235  dlogf_dx.AddSpVec(-1.0, S, x, 1.0);
3236  KALDI_VLOG(2) << "Gradient magnitude is " << dlogf_dx.Norm(2.0);
3237  Real f = Exp(c * logf);
3238  Vector<Real> df_dx(dlogf_dx);
3239  df_dx.Scale(f * c); // comes from derivative of the exponential function.
3240  f *= sign;
3241  df_dx.Scale(sign);
3242  opt_lbfgs.DoStep(f, df_dx);
3243  num_iters++;
3244  }
3245  Vector<Real> x (opt_lbfgs.GetValue());
3246  Vector<Real> diff(x);
3247  diff.AddVec(-1.0, x_opt);
3248  KALDI_VLOG(2) << "L-BFGS finished after " << num_iters << " function evaluations.";
3249  /*
3250  if (sizeof(Real) == 8) {
3251  KALDI_ASSERT(diff.Norm(2.0) < 0.5);
3252  } else {
3253  KALDI_ASSERT(diff.Norm(2.0) < 2.0);
3254  } */
3255  }
3256  g_kaldi_verbose_level = temp;
3257 }

3260 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestLinearCgd() {
3261  for (int i = 0; i < 20 ; i++) {
3262  MatrixIndexT M = 1 + Rand() % 20;
3263 
3264  SpMatrix<Real> A(M);
3265  RandPosdefSpMatrix(M, &A);
3266  Vector<Real> x(M), b(M), b2(M);
3267 
3268  LinearCgdOptions opts;
3269  if (Rand() % 2 == 0)
3270  opts.max_iters = 1 + Rand() % 10;
3271  if (Rand() % 2 == 0)
3272  opts.max_error = 1.0; // note: an absolute, not relative, error.
3273 
3274  x.SetRandn();
3275 
3276  b.AddSpVec(1.0, A, x, 0.0);
3277  Vector<Real> x_e(M); // x_e means x_estimated.
3278  x_e.SetRandn();
3279 
3280  int32 iters = LinearCgd(opts, A, b, &x_e);
3281 
3282  b2.AddSpVec(1.0, A, x_e, 0.0);
3283 
3284  Vector<Real> residual_error(b);
3285  residual_error.AddVec(-1.0, b2);
3286 
3287  BaseFloat error = residual_error.Norm(2.0);
3288 
3289  if (iters >= M) {
3290  // should have converged fully.
3291  Real max_abs = A.MaxAbsEig();
3292  KALDI_LOG << "error = " << error << ", b norm is " << b.Norm(2.0)
3293  << ", A max-abs-eig is " << max_abs;
3294  KALDI_ASSERT(error < 1.0e-04 * b.Norm(2.0) * max_abs);
3295  } else {
3296  BaseFloat wiggle_room = 1.1;
3297  if (opts.max_iters >= 0) {
3298  KALDI_ASSERT(iters <= opts.max_iters);
3299  if (iters < opts.max_iters) {
3300  KALDI_ASSERT(error <= wiggle_room * opts.max_error);
3301  }
3302  } else {
3303  KALDI_ASSERT(error <= wiggle_room * opts.max_error);
3304  }
3305  }
3306  }
3307 }

3310 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestMaxMin() {
3311 
3312  MatrixIndexT M = 1 + Rand() % 10, N = 1 + Rand() % 10;
3313  {
3314  Vector<Real> v(N);
3315  InitRand(&v);
3316  Real min = 1.0e+10, max = -1.0e+10;
3317  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i< N; i++) {
3318  min = std::min(min, v(i));
3319  max = std::max(max, v(i));
3320  }
3321  AssertEqual(min, v.Min());
3322  AssertEqual(max, v.Max());
3323  }
3324  {
3325  SpMatrix<Real> S(N);
3326  InitRand(&S);
3327  Real min = 1.0e+10, max = -1.0e+10;
3328  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i< N; i++) {
3329  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
3330  min = std::min(min, S(i, j));
3331  max = std::max(max, S(i, j));
3332  }
3333  }
3334  AssertEqual(min, S.Min());
3335  AssertEqual(max, S.Max());
3336  }
3337  {
3338  Matrix<Real> mat(M, N);
3339  InitRand(&mat);
3340  Real min = 1.0e+10, max = -1.0e+10;
3341  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i< M; i++) {
3342  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j < N; j++) {
3343  min = std::min(min, mat(i, j));
3344  max = std::max(max, mat(i, j));
3345  }
3346  }
3347  AssertEqual(min, mat.Min());
3348  AssertEqual(max, mat.Max());
3349  }
3350 }

3352 template<typename Real>
3353 static bool approx_equal(Real a, Real b) {
3354  return ( std::abs(a-b) <= 1.0e-03 * (std::abs(a)+std::abs(b)));

3357 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestTrace() {
3358 
3359  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0;i < 5;i++) {
3360  MatrixIndexT dimM = 20 + Rand()%10, dimN = 20 + Rand()%10, dimO = 20 + Rand()%10, dimP = dimM;
3361  Matrix<Real> A(dimM, dimN), B(dimN, dimO), C(dimO, dimP);
3362  InitRand(&A); InitRand(&B); InitRand(&C);
3363  Matrix<Real> AT(dimN, dimM), BT(dimO, dimN), CT(dimP, dimO);
3364  AT.CopyFromMat(A, kTrans); BT.CopyFromMat(B, kTrans); CT.CopyFromMat(C, kTrans);
3365 
3366  Matrix<Real> AB(dimM, dimO);
3367  AB.AddMatMat(1.0, A, kNoTrans, B, kNoTrans, 0.0);
3368  Matrix<Real> BC(dimN, dimP);
3369  BC.AddMatMat(1.0, B, kNoTrans, C, kNoTrans, 0.0);
3370  Matrix<Real> ABC(dimM, dimP);
3371  ABC.AddMatMat(1.0, A, kNoTrans, BC, kNoTrans, 0.0);
3372 
3373  Real
3374  t1 = TraceMat(ABC),
3375  t2 = ABC.Trace(),
3376  t3 = TraceMatMat(A, BC),
3377  t4 = TraceMatMat(AT, BC, kTrans),
3378  t5 = TraceMatMat(BC, AT, kTrans),
3379  t6 = TraceMatMatMat(A, kNoTrans, B, kNoTrans, C, kNoTrans),
3380  t7 = TraceMatMatMat(AT, kTrans, B, kNoTrans, C, kNoTrans),
3381  t8 = TraceMatMatMat(AT, kTrans, BT, kTrans, C, kNoTrans),
3382  t9 = TraceMatMatMat(AT, kTrans, BT, kTrans, CT, kTrans);
3383 
3384  Matrix<Real> ABC1(dimM, dimP); // tests AddMatMatMat.
3385  ABC1.AddMatMatMat(1.0, A, kNoTrans, B, kNoTrans, C, kNoTrans, 0.0);
3386  AssertEqual(ABC, ABC1);
3387 
3388  Matrix<Real> ABC2(dimM, dimP); // tests AddMatMatMat.
3389  ABC2.AddMatMatMat(0.25, A, kNoTrans, B, kNoTrans, C, kNoTrans, 0.0);
3390  ABC2.AddMatMatMat(0.25, AT, kTrans, B, kNoTrans, C, kNoTrans, 2.0); // the extra 1.0 means another 0.25.
3391  ABC2.AddMatMatMat(0.125, A, kNoTrans, BT, kTrans, C, kNoTrans, 1.0);
3392  ABC2.AddMatMatMat(0.125, A, kNoTrans, B, kNoTrans, CT, kTrans, 1.0);
3393  AssertEqual(ABC, ABC2);
3394 
3395  Real tol = 0.001;
3396  KALDI_ASSERT((std::abs(t1-t2) < tol) && (std::abs(t2-t3) < tol) && (std::abs(t3-t4) < tol)
3397  && (std::abs(t4-t5) < tol) && (std::abs(t5-t6) < tol) && (std::abs(t6-t7) < tol)
3398  && (std::abs(t7-t8) < tol) && (std::abs(t8-t9) < tol));
3399  }
3400 
3401  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0;i < 5;i++) {
3402  MatrixIndexT dimM = 20 + Rand()%10, dimN = 20 + Rand()%10;
3403  SpMatrix<Real> S(dimM), T(dimN);
3404  InitRand(&S); InitRand(&T);
3405  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimN), O(dimM, dimN);
3406  InitRand(&M); InitRand(&O);
3407  Matrix<Real> sM(S), tM(T);
3408 
3409  Real x1 = TraceMatMat(tM, tM);
3410  Real x2 = TraceSpMat(T, tM);
3411  KALDI_ASSERT(approx_equal(x1, x2) || fabs(x1-x2) < 0.1);
3412 
3413  Real t1 = TraceMatMatMat(M, kNoTrans, tM, kNoTrans, M, kTrans);
3414  Real t2 = TraceMatSpMat(M, kNoTrans, T, M, kTrans);
3415  KALDI_ASSERT(approx_equal(t1, t2) || fabs(t1-12) < 0.1);
3416 
3417  Real u1 = TraceMatSpMatSp(M, kNoTrans, T, O, kTrans, S);
3418  Real u2 = TraceMatMatMatMat(M, kNoTrans, tM, kNoTrans, O, kTrans, sM, kNoTrans);
3419  KALDI_ASSERT(approx_equal(u1, u2) || fabs(u1-u2) < 0.1);
3420  }
3421

3740  AssertEqual(y, 0.0);
3741  }
3742  {
3743  Real x, y;
3744  x = 0.5; y = -0.3;
3745  bool ans = AttemptComplexPower(&x, &y, static_cast<Real>(2.21));
3746  KALDI_ASSERT(ans);
3747  ans = AttemptComplexPower(&x, &y, static_cast<Real>(1.0/2.21));
3748  KALDI_ASSERT(ans);
3749  AssertEqual(x, 0.5);
3750  AssertEqual(y, -0.3);
3751  }
3752  {
3753  Real x, y;
3754  x = 0.5; y = -0.3;
3755  bool ans = AttemptComplexPower(&x, &y, static_cast<Real>(2.0));
3756  KALDI_ASSERT(ans);
3757  AssertEqual(x, 0.5*0.5 - 0.3*0.3);
3758  AssertEqual(y, -0.3*0.5*2.0);
3759  }
3760 
3761  {
3762  Real x, y;
3763  x = 1.0/std::sqrt(2.0); y = -1.0/std::sqrt(2.0);
3764  bool ans = AttemptComplexPower(&x, &y, static_cast<Real>(-1.0));
3765  KALDI_ASSERT(ans);
3766  AssertEqual(x, 1.0/std::sqrt(2.0));
3767  AssertEqual(y, 1.0/std::sqrt(2.0));
3768  }
3769 
3770  {
3771  Real x, y;
3772  x = 0.0; y = 0.0;
3773  bool ans = AttemptComplexPower(&x, &y, static_cast<Real>(-2.0));
3774  KALDI_ASSERT(!ans); // zero; negative pow.
3775  }
3776  {
3777  Real x, y;
3778  x = -2.0; y = 0.0;
3779  bool ans = AttemptComplexPower(&x, &y, static_cast<Real>(1.5));
3780  KALDI_ASSERT(!ans); // negative real case
3781  }
3782 }
3783 template<typename Real>
3784 void UnitTestNonsymmetricPower() {
3785 
3786  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0; iter < 30; iter++) {
3787  MatrixIndexT dimM = 1 + Rand() % 20;
3788  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimM);
3789  InitRand(&M);
3790 
3791  Matrix<Real> MM(dimM, dimM);
3792  MM.AddMatMat(1.0, M, kNoTrans, M, kNoTrans, 0.0); // MM = M M.
3793  Matrix<Real> MMMM(dimM, dimM);
3794  MMMM.AddMatMat(1.0, MM, kNoTrans, MM, kNoTrans, 0.0);
3795 
3796  Matrix<Real> MM2(MM);
3797  bool b = MM2.Power(1.0);
3798  KALDI_ASSERT(b);
3799  AssertEqual(MM2, MM);
3800  Matrix<Real> MMMM2(MM);
3801  b = MMMM2.Power(2.0);
3802  KALDI_ASSERT(b);
3803  AssertEqual(MMMM2, MMMM);
3804  }
3805  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0; iter < 30; iter++) {
3806  MatrixIndexT dimM = 1 + Rand() % 20;
3807  Matrix<Real> M(dimM, dimM);
3808  InitRand(&M);
3809 
3810  Matrix<Real> MM(dimM, dimM);
3811  MM.AddMatMat(1.0, M, kNoTrans, M, kNoTrans, 0.0); // MM = M M.
3812  // This ensures there are no real, negative eigenvalues.
3813 
3814  Matrix<Real> MMMM(dimM, dimM);
3815  MMMM.AddMatMat(1.0, MM, kNoTrans, MM, kNoTrans, 0.0);
3816 
3817  Matrix<Real> MM2(M);
3818  if (!MM2.Power(2.0)) { // possibly had negative eigenvalues
3819  KALDI_LOG << "Could not take matrix to power (not an error)";
3820  } else {
3821  AssertEqual(MM2, MM);
3822  }
3823  Matrix<Real> MMMM2(M);
3824  if (!MMMM2.Power(4.0)) { // possibly had negative eigenvalues
3825  KALDI_LOG << "Could not take matrix to power (not an error)";
3826  } else {
3827  AssertEqual(MMMM2, MMMM);
3828  }
3829  Matrix<Real> MMMM3(MM);
3830  if (!MMMM3.Power(2.0)) {
3831  KALDI_ERR << "Could not take matrix to power (should have been able to)";
3832  } else {
3833  AssertEqual(MMMM3, MMMM);
3834  }
3835 
3836  Matrix<Real> MM4(MM);
3837  if (!MM4.Power(-1.0))
3838  KALDI_ERR << "Could not take matrix to power (should have been able to)";
3839  MM4.Invert();
3840  AssertEqual(MM4, MM);
3841  }
3842 }

3883 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestMatrixExponential() {
3884 
3885  for (MatrixIndexT p = 0; p < 10; p++) {
3886  MatrixIndexT dim = 1 + Rand() % 5;
3887  Matrix<Real> M(dim, dim);
3888  InitRand(&M);
3889  { // work out largest eig.
3890  Real largest_eig = 0.0;
3891  Vector<Real> real_eigs(dim), imag_eigs(dim);
3892  M.Eig(NULL, &real_eigs, &imag_eigs);
3893  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < dim; i++) {
3894  Real abs_eig =
3895  std::sqrt(real_eigs(i)*real_eigs(i) + imag_eigs(i)*imag_eigs(i));
3896  largest_eig = std::max(largest_eig, abs_eig);
3897  }
3898  if (largest_eig > 0.5) { // limit largest eig to 0.5,
3899  // so Taylor expansion will converge.
3900  M.Scale(0.5 / largest_eig);
3901  }
3902  }
3903 
3904  Matrix<Real> expM(dim, dim);
3905  Matrix<Real> cur_pow(dim, dim);
3906  cur_pow.SetUnit();
3907  Real i_factorial = 1.0;
3908  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 52; i++) { // since max-eig = 0.5 and 2**52 == dbl eps.
3909  if (i > 0) i_factorial *= i;
3910  expM.AddMat(1.0/i_factorial, cur_pow);
3911  Matrix<Real> tmp(dim, dim);
3912  tmp.AddMatMat(1.0, cur_pow, kNoTrans, M, kNoTrans, 0.0);
3913  cur_pow.CopyFromMat(tmp);
3914  }
3915  Matrix<Real> expM2(dim, dim);
3916  MatrixExponential<Real> mexp;
3917  mexp.Compute(M, &expM2);
3918  AssertEqual(expM, expM2);
3919  }
3920 }
3921 
3922 
3923 static void UnitTestMatrixExponentialBackprop() {
3924  for (MatrixIndexT p = 0; p < 10; p++) {
3925  MatrixIndexT dim = 1 + Rand() % 5;
3926  // f is tr(N^T exp(M)). backpropagating derivative
3927  // of this function.
3928  Matrix<double> M(dim, dim), N(dim, dim), delta(dim, dim);
3929  InitRand(&M);
3930  // { SpMatrix<double> tmp(dim); InitRand(&tmp); M.CopyFromSp(tmp); }
3931  InitRand(&N);
3932  InitRand(&delta);
3933  // { SpMatrix<double> tmp(dim); InitRand(&tmp); delta.CopyFromSp(tmp); }
3934  delta.Scale(0.00001);
3935 
3936 
3937  Matrix<double> expM(dim, dim);
3938  MatrixExponential<double> mexp;
3939  mexp.Compute(M, &expM);
3940 
3941  Matrix<double> expM2(dim, dim);
3942  {
3943  Matrix<double> M2(M);
3944  M2.AddMat(1.0, delta, kNoTrans);
3945  MatrixExponential<double> mexp2;
3946  mexp2.Compute(M2, &expM2);
3947  }
3948  double f_before = TraceMatMat(expM, N, kTrans);
3949  double f_after = TraceMatMat(expM2, N, kTrans);
3950 
3951  Matrix<double> Mdash(dim, dim);
3952  mexp.Backprop(N, &Mdash);
3953  // now Mdash should be df/dM
3954 
3955  double f_diff = f_after - f_before; // computed using method of differnces
3956  double f_diff2 = TraceMatMat(Mdash, delta, kTrans); // computed "analytically"
3957  KALDI_LOG << "f_diff = " << f_diff;
3958  KALDI_LOG << "f_diff2 = " << f_diff2;
3959 
3960  AssertEqual(f_diff, f_diff2);
3961  }
3962 }
3963 template<typename Real>
3964 static void UnitTestPca(bool full_test) {
3965  // We'll test that we can exactly reconstruct the vectors, if
3966  // the PCA dim is <= the "real" dim that the vectors live in.
3967  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
3968  bool exact = i % 2 == 0;
3969  MatrixIndexT true_dim = (full_test ? 200 : 50) + Rand() % 5, //dim of subspace points live in
3970  feat_dim = true_dim + Rand() % 5, // dim of feature space
3971  num_points = true_dim + Rand() % 5, // number of training points.
3972  G = std::min(feat_dim,
3973  std::min(num_points,
3974  static_cast<MatrixIndexT>(true_dim + Rand() % 5)));
3975 
3976  Matrix<Real> Proj(feat_dim, true_dim);
3977  Proj.SetRandn();
3978  Matrix<Real> true_X(num_points, true_dim);
3979  true_X.SetRandn();
3980  Matrix<Real> X(num_points, feat_dim);
3981  X.AddMatMat(1.0, true_X, kNoTrans, Proj, kTrans, 0.0);
3982 
3983  Matrix<Real> U(G, feat_dim); // the basis
3984  Matrix<Real> A(num_points, G); // projection of points into the basis..
3985  ComputePca(X, &U, &A, true, exact);
3986  {
3987  SpMatrix<Real> I(G);
3988  I.AddMat2(1.0, U, kNoTrans, 0.0);
3989  KALDI_LOG << "Non-unit-ness of U is " << NonUnitness(I);
3990  KALDI_ASSERT(I.IsUnit(0.001));
3991  }
3992  Matrix<Real> X2(num_points, feat_dim);
3993  X2.AddMatMat(1.0, A, kNoTrans, U, kNoTrans, 0.0);
3994  // Check reproduction.
3995  KALDI_LOG << "A.Sum() " << A.Sum() << ", U.Sum() " << U.Sum();
3996  AssertEqual(X, X2, 0.01);
3997  // Check basis is orthogonal.
3998  Matrix<Real> tmp(G, G);
3999  tmp.AddMatMat(1.0, U, kNoTrans, U, kTrans, 0.0);
4000  KALDI_ASSERT(tmp.IsUnit(0.01));
4001  }
4002 }

4005 /* UnitTestPca2 test the same function, but it's more geared towards
4006  the 'inexact' method and for when you want less than the full number
4007  of PCA dimensions.
4008  */
4009 
4010 template<typename Real>
4011 static void UnitTestPca2(bool full_test) {
4012  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
4013  // MatrixIndexT feat_dim = 600, num_points = 300;
4014  MatrixIndexT feat_dim = (full_test ? 600 : 100),
4015  num_points = (i%2 == 0 ? feat_dim * 2 : feat_dim / 2); // test
4016  // both branches of PCA code, inner + outer.
4017 
4018  Matrix<Real> X(num_points, feat_dim);
4019  X.SetRandn();
4020 
4021  MatrixIndexT pca_dim = 30;
4022 
4023  Matrix<Real> U(pca_dim, feat_dim); // rows PCA directions.
4024  bool print_eigs = true, exact = false;
4025  ComputePca(X, &U, static_cast<Matrix<Real>*>(NULL), print_eigs, exact);
4026 
4027  Real non_orth = NonOrthogonality(U, kNoTrans);
4028  KALDI_ASSERT(non_orth < 0.001);
4029  KALDI_LOG << "Non-orthogonality of U is " << non_orth;
4030  Matrix<Real> U2(pca_dim, feat_dim);
4031 
4032  {
4033  SpMatrix<Real> Scatter(feat_dim);
4034  Scatter.AddMat2(1.0, X, kTrans, 0.0);
4035  Matrix<Real> V(feat_dim, feat_dim);
4036  Vector<Real> l(feat_dim);
4037  Scatter.Eig(&l, &V); // cols of V are eigenvectors.
4038  SortSvd(&l, &V); // Get top dims.
4039  U2.CopyFromMat(SubMatrix<Real>(V, 0, feat_dim, 0, pca_dim), kTrans);
4040  Real non_orth = NonOrthogonality(U2, kNoTrans);
4041  KALDI_ASSERT(non_orth < 0.001);
4042  KALDI_LOG << "Non-orthogonality of U2 is " << non_orth;
4043 
4044  SpMatrix<Real> ScatterProjU(pca_dim), ScatterProjU2(pca_dim);
4045  ScatterProjU.AddMat2Sp(1.0, U, kNoTrans, Scatter, 0.0);
4046  ScatterProjU2.AddMat2Sp(1.0, U2, kNoTrans, Scatter, 0.0);
4047  KALDI_LOG << "Non-diagonality of proj with U is "
4048  << NonDiagonalness(ScatterProjU);
4049  KALDI_LOG << "Non-diagonality of proj with U2 is "
4050  << NonDiagonalness(ScatterProjU2);
4051  KALDI_ASSERT(ScatterProjU.IsDiagonal(0.01)); // Algorithm is statistical,
4052  // so it ends up being less accurate.
4053  KALDI_ASSERT(ScatterProjU2.IsDiagonal());
4054  KALDI_LOG << "Trace proj with U is " << ScatterProjU.Trace()
4055  << " with U2 is " << ScatterProjU2.Trace();
4056  AssertEqual(ScatterProjU.Trace(), ScatterProjU2.Trace(), 0.1);// Algorithm is
4057  // statistical so give it some leeway.
4058  }
4059  }
4060 }

4081  end = time(NULL);

4084  << " seconds.";

4089  S.SetRandn();
4090  Vector<Real> l(size);
4091  Matrix<Real> P(size, size);
4092  S.Eig(&l, &P);
4093  end = time(NULL);
4094  double diff = difftime(end, start);
4095  KALDI_LOG << "For size " << size << ", Eig with eigenvectors took " << diff
4096  << " seconds.";
4097  }

4100  Matrix<Real> M(size, size);
4101  M.SetRandn();
4102  Vector<Real> l(size);
4103  M.Svd(&l, NULL, NULL);
4104  end = time(NULL);

4106  KALDI_LOG << "For size " << size << ", SVD without eigenvectors took " << diff
4107  << " seconds.";
4108  }
4109  {
4110  start = time(NULL);
4111  Matrix<Real> M(size, size), U(size, size), V(size, size);
4112  M.SetRandn();
4113  Vector<Real> l(size);
4114  M.Svd(&l, &U, &V);
4115  end = time(NULL);
4116  double diff = difftime(end, start);
4117  KALDI_LOG << "For size " << size << ", SVD with eigenvectors took " << diff
4118  << " seconds.";
4119  }
4120  }

4123 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestCompressedMatrix() {
4124  // This is the basic test.
4125 
4126  CompressedMatrix empty_cmat; // some tests on empty matrix
4127  KALDI_ASSERT(empty_cmat.NumRows() == 0);
4128  KALDI_ASSERT(empty_cmat.NumCols() == 0);
4129 
4130  // could set num_tot to 10000 for more thorough testing.
4131  MatrixIndexT num_failure = 0, num_tot = 10000, max_failure = 1;
4132  for (MatrixIndexT n = 0; n < num_tot; n++) {
4133  MatrixIndexT num_rows = Rand() % 20, num_cols = Rand() % 15;
4134  if (num_rows * num_cols == 0) {
4135  num_rows = 0;
4136  num_cols = 0;
4137  }
4138  if (rand() % 2 == 0 && num_cols != 0) {
4139  // smaller matrices are more likely to have problems.
4140  num_cols = 1 + Rand() % 3;
4141  }
4142  Matrix<Real> M(num_rows, num_cols);
4143  if (Rand() % 3 != 0) InitRand(&M);
4144  else {
4145  M.Add(RandGauss());
4146  }
4147  if (Rand() % 2 == 0 && num_rows != 0) { // set one row to all the same value,
4148  // which is one possible pathology.
4149  // Give it large dynamic range to increase chance that it
4150  // is the largest or smallest value in the matrix.
4151  M.Row(Rand() % num_rows).Set(RandGauss() * 4.0);
4152  }
4153  double rand_val = RandGauss() * 4.0;
4154  // set a bunch of elements to all one value: increases
4155  // chance of pathologies.
4156  MatrixIndexT modulus = 1 + Rand() % 5;
4157  for (MatrixIndexT r = 0; r < num_rows; r++)
4158  for (MatrixIndexT c = 0; c < num_cols; c++)
4159  if (Rand() % modulus != 0) M(r, c) = rand_val;
4160 
4161  CompressedMatrix cmat(M);
4162  KALDI_ASSERT(cmat.NumRows() == num_rows);
4163  KALDI_ASSERT(cmat.NumCols() == num_cols);
4164 
4165  Matrix<Real> M2(cmat.NumRows(), cmat.NumCols());
4166  cmat.CopyToMat(&M2);
4167 
4168  Matrix<Real> diff(M2);
4169  diff.AddMat(-1.0, M);
4170 
4171  { // Check that when compressing a matrix that has already been compressed,
4172  // and uncompressing, we get the same answer.
4173  // ok, actually, we can't guarantee this, so just limit the number of failures.
4174  CompressedMatrix cmat2(M2);
4175  Matrix<Real> M3(cmat.NumRows(), cmat.NumCols());
4176  cmat2.CopyToMat(&M3);
4177  if (!M2.ApproxEqual(M3, 1.0e-04)) {
4178  KALDI_LOG << "cmat is: ";
4179  cmat.Write(std::cout, false);
4180  KALDI_LOG << "cmat2 is: ";
4181  cmat2.Write(std::cout, false);
4182  KALDI_WARN << "Matrices differ " << M2 << " vs. " << M3 << ", M2 range is "
4183  << M2.Min() << " to " << M2.Max() << ", M3 range is "
4184  << M3.Min() << " to " << M3.Max();
4185  num_failure++;
4186  }
4187  }
4188 
4189  // test CopyRowToVec
4190  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < num_rows; i++) {
4191  Vector<Real> V(num_cols);
4192  cmat.CopyRowToVec(i, &V); // get row.
4193  for (MatrixIndexT k = 0; k < num_cols; k++) {
4194  AssertEqual(M2(i, k), V(k));
4195  }
4196  }
4197 
4198  // test CopyColToVec
4199  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < num_cols; i++) {
4200  Vector<Real> V(num_rows);
4201  cmat.CopyColToVec(i, &V); // get col.
4202  for (MatrixIndexT k = 0;k < num_rows;k++) {
4203  AssertEqual(M2(k, i), V(k));
4204  }
4205  }
4206 
4207  //test of getting a submatrix
4208  if(num_rows != 0 && num_cols != 0){
4209  MatrixIndexT sub_row_offset = Rand() % num_rows,
4210  sub_col_offset = Rand() % num_cols;
4211  // to make sure we don't mod by zero
4212  MatrixIndexT num_subrows = Rand() % (num_rows-sub_row_offset),
4213  num_subcols = Rand() % (num_cols-sub_col_offset);
4214  if(num_subrows == 0 || num_subcols == 0){ // in case we randomized to
4215  // empty matrix, at least make it correct
4216  num_subrows = 0;
4217  num_subcols = 0;
4218  }
4219  Matrix<Real> Msub(num_subrows, num_subcols);
4220  cmat.CopyToMat(sub_row_offset, sub_col_offset, &Msub);
4221  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < num_subrows; i++) {
4222  for (MatrixIndexT k = 0;k < num_subcols;k++) {
4223  AssertEqual(M2(i+sub_row_offset, k+sub_col_offset), Msub(i, k));
4224  }
4225  }
4226  }
4227 
4228  if (n < 5) { // test I/O.
4229  bool binary = (n % 2 == 1);
4230  {
4231  std::ofstream outs("tmpf", std::ios_base::out |std::ios_base::binary);
4232  InitKaldiOutputStream(outs, binary);
4233  cmat.Write(outs, binary);
4234  }
4235  CompressedMatrix cmat2;
4236  {
4237  bool binary_in;
4238  std::ifstream ins("tmpf", std::ios_base::in | std::ios_base::binary);
4239  InitKaldiInputStream(ins, &binary_in);
4240  cmat2.Read(ins, binary_in);
4241  }
4242 #if 1
4243  { // check that compressed-matrix can be read as matrix.
4244  bool binary_in;
4245  std::ifstream ins("tmpf", std::ios_base::in | std::ios_base::binary);
4246  InitKaldiInputStream(ins, &binary_in);
4247  Matrix<Real> mat1;
4248  mat1.Read(ins, binary_in);
4249  Matrix<Real> mat2(cmat2);
4250  AssertEqual(mat1, mat2);
4251  }
4252 #endif
4253 
4254 
4255  { // check that matrix can be read as compressed-matrix.
4256  Matrix<Real> mat1(cmat);
4257  {
4258  std::ofstream outs("tmpf", std::ios_base::out |std::ios_base::binary);
4259  InitKaldiOutputStream(outs, binary);
4260  mat1.Write(outs, binary);
4261  }
4262  bool binary_in;
4263  std::ifstream ins("tmpf", std::ios_base::in | std::ios_base::binary);
4264  InitKaldiInputStream(ins, &binary_in);
4265  CompressedMatrix cmat2;
4266  cmat2.Read(ins, binary_in);
4267  Matrix<Real> mat2(cmat2);
4268  AssertEqual(mat1, mat2);
4269  }
4270 
4271 
4272  Matrix<Real> M3(cmat2.NumRows(), cmat2.NumCols());
4273  cmat2.CopyToMat(&M3);
4274  AssertEqual(M2, M3); // tests I/O of CompressedMatrix.
4275 
4276  CompressedMatrix cmat3(cmat2); // testing self-constructor, which
4277  // tests assignment operator.
4278  Matrix<Real> M4(cmat3.NumRows(), cmat3.NumCols());
4279  cmat3.CopyToMat(&M4);
4280  AssertEqual(M2, M4);
4281  }
4282  KALDI_LOG << "M = " << M;
4283  KALDI_LOG << "M2 = " << M2;
4284  double tot = M.FrobeniusNorm(), err = diff.FrobeniusNorm();
4285  KALDI_LOG << "Compressed matrix, tot = " << tot << ", diff = "
4286  << err;
4287  if (err > 0.015 * tot) {
4288  KALDI_WARN << "Failure in compressed-matrix test.";
4289  num_failure++;
4290  }
4291  }
4292  if (num_failure > max_failure)
4293  KALDI_ERR << "Too many failures in compressed matrix test " << num_failure
4294  << " > " << max_failure;
4295 
4296  unlink("tmpf");
4297 }
4298 
4299 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestGeneralMatrix() {
4300  // This is the basic test.
4301 
4302  GeneralMatrix empty_pmat; // some tests on empty matrix
4303  KALDI_ASSERT(empty_pmat.NumRows() == 0);
4304  KALDI_ASSERT(empty_pmat.NumCols() == 0);
4305 
4306  // could set num_tot to 10000 for more thorough testing.
4307  MatrixIndexT num_failure = 0, num_tot = 10000, max_failure = 1;
4308  for (MatrixIndexT n = 0; n < num_tot; n++) {
4309  MatrixIndexT num_rows = Rand() % 20, num_cols = Rand() % 15;
4310  if (num_rows * num_cols == 0) {
4311  num_rows = 0;
4312  num_cols = 0;
4313  }
4314  if (rand() % 2 == 0 && num_cols != 0) {
4315  // smaller matrices are more likely to have problems.
4316  num_cols = 1 + Rand() % 3;
4317  }
4318  Matrix<Real> M(num_rows, num_cols);
4319  if (Rand() % 3 != 0) InitRand(&M);
4320  else {
4321  M.Add(RandGauss());
4322  }
4323  if (Rand() % 2 == 0 && num_rows != 0) { // set one row to all the same value,
4324  // which is one possible pathology.
4325  // Give it large dynamic range to increase chance that it
4326  // is the largest or smallest value in the matrix.
4327  M.Row(Rand() % num_rows).Set(RandGauss() * 4.0);
4328  }
4329  double rand_val = RandGauss() * 4.0;
4330  // set a bunch of elements to all one value: increases
4331  // chance of pathologies.
4332  MatrixIndexT modulus = 1 + Rand() % 5;
4333  for (MatrixIndexT r = 0; r < num_rows; r++)
4334  for (MatrixIndexT c = 0; c < num_cols; c++)
4335  if (Rand() % modulus != 0) M(r, c) = rand_val;
4336 
4337  GeneralMatrix pmat(M);
4338  if (RandInt(0, 1) == 0)
4339  pmat.Compress();
4340 
4341  if (RandInt(0, 1) == 0) {
4342  SparseMatrix<BaseFloat> smat(num_rows, num_cols);
4343  smat.SetRandn(0.1);
4344  pmat.Clear();
4345  smat.CopyToMat(&M, kNoTrans);
4346  pmat.SwapSparseMatrix(&smat);
4347  }
4348 
4349  KALDI_ASSERT(pmat.NumRows() == num_rows);
4350  KALDI_ASSERT(pmat.NumCols() == num_cols);
4351  GeneralMatrix pmat2(pmat);
4352 
4353  Matrix<Real> M2(pmat2.NumRows(), pmat2.NumCols());
4354  pmat2.GetMatrix(&M2);
4355 
4356  Matrix<Real> diff(M2);
4357  diff.AddMat(-1.0, M);
4358 
4359  if (n < 5) { // test I/O.
4360  bool binary = (n % 2 == 1);
4361  {
4362  std::ofstream outs("tmpf", std::ios_base::out |std::ios_base::binary);
4363  InitKaldiOutputStream(outs, binary);
4364  pmat.Write(outs, binary);
4365  }
4366  GeneralMatrix pmat3;
4367  {
4368  bool binary_in;
4369  std::ifstream ins("tmpf", std::ios_base::in | std::ios_base::binary);
4370  InitKaldiInputStream(ins, &binary_in);
4371  pmat3.Read(ins, binary_in);
4372  }
4373 
4374  Matrix<Real> M3(pmat3.NumRows(), pmat3.NumCols());
4375  pmat3.GetMatrix(&M3);
4376  AssertEqual(M, M3);
4377  }
4378 
4379  KALDI_LOG << "M = " << M;
4380  KALDI_LOG << "M2 = " << M2;
4381  double tot = M.FrobeniusNorm(), err = diff.FrobeniusNorm();
4382  KALDI_LOG << "Compressed matrix, tot = " << tot << ", diff = "
4383  << err;
4384  if (err > 0.015 * tot) {
4385  KALDI_WARN << "Failure in possibly compressed-matrix test.";
4386  num_failure++;
4387  }
4388  }
4389  if (num_failure > max_failure)
4390  KALDI_ERR << "Too many failures in possibly compressed matrix test " << num_failure
4391  << " > " << max_failure;
4392 
4393  unlink("tmpf");
4394 }

4396 template<typename Real>
4397 static void UnitTestExtractCompressedMatrix() {
4398  for (int32 i = 0; i < 30; i++) {
4399  MatrixIndexT num_rows = Rand() % 20, num_cols = Rand() % 30;
4400  if (num_rows * num_cols == 0) {
4401  // this test wouldn't work for empty matrices.
4402  num_rows++;
4403  num_cols++;
4404  }
4405  Matrix<Real> mat(num_rows, num_cols);
4406  mat.SetRandn();
4407  CompressedMatrix cmat(mat);
4408 
4409  MatrixIndexT row_offset = Rand() % num_rows, col_offset = Rand() % num_cols;
4410  MatrixIndexT sub_num_rows = Rand() % (num_rows - row_offset) + 1,
4411  sub_num_cols = Rand() % (num_cols - col_offset) + 1;
4412  KALDI_VLOG(3) << "Whole matrix size: " << num_rows << "," << num_cols;
4413  KALDI_VLOG(3) << "Sub-matrix size: " << sub_num_rows << "," << sub_num_cols
4414  << " with offsets " << row_offset << "," << col_offset;
4415  CompressedMatrix cmat2(cmat, row_offset, sub_num_rows, //take a subset of
4416  col_offset, sub_num_cols); // the compressed matrix
4417  Matrix<Real> mat2(sub_num_rows, sub_num_cols);
4418  cmat2.CopyToMat(&mat2); // uncompress the subset of the compressed matrix
4419 
4420  Matrix<Real> mat3(cmat); // uncompress the whole compressed matrix
4421  SubMatrix<Real> sub_mat(mat3, row_offset, sub_num_rows, col_offset, sub_num_cols);
4422  if(!sub_mat.ApproxEqual(mat2)) {
4423  KALDI_ERR << "Matrices differ " << sub_mat << " vs. " << mat2;
4424  }
4425  }
4426 }

4429 template<typename Real>
4430 static void UnitTestTridiag() {
4431  SpMatrix<Real> A(3);
4432  A(1,1) = 1.0;
4433  A(1, 2) = 1.0;
4434  KALDI_ASSERT(A.IsTridiagonal());
4435  A(0, 2) = 1.0;
4436  KALDI_ASSERT(!A.IsTridiagonal());
4437  A(0, 2) = 0.0;
4438  A(0, 1) = 1.0;
4439  KALDI_ASSERT(A.IsTridiagonal());
4440 }
