4442 template<typename Real>
4443 static void UnitTestRandCategorical() {
4444  int32 N = 1 + Rand() % 10;
4445  Vector<Real> vec(N);
4446  for (int32 n = 0; n < N; n++)
4447  vec(n) = Rand() % 3;
4448  if (vec.Sum() == 0)
4449  vec(0) = 2.0;
4450  Real sum = vec.Sum();
4451  int32 num_samples = 100000;
4452  std::vector<int32> counts(N, 0);
4453  for (int32 i = 0; i < num_samples; i++)
4454  counts[vec.RandCategorical()]++;
4455  for (int32 n = 0; n < N; n++) {
4456  Real a = counts[n] / (1.0 * num_samples),
4457  b = vec(n) / sum;
4458  KALDI_LOG << "a = " << a << ", b = " << b;
4459  KALDI_ASSERT(fabs(a - b) <= 0.1); // pretty arbitrary. Will increase #samp if fails.
4460  }
4461 }

4464 template<class Real>
4465 void PlaceNansInGaps(Matrix<Real> *mat) {
4466  int32 num_rows = mat->NumRows(), num_cols = mat->NumCols(),
4467  stride = mat->Stride();
4468  BaseFloat not_a_number = nan(" "); // nan is from <cmath>
4469  for (int32 r = 0; r + 1 < num_rows; r++) {
4470  for (int32 j = num_cols; j < stride; j++) {
4471  if (RandInt(0, 1) == 0)
4472  (mat->RowData(r))[j] = not_a_number;
4473  else
4474  (mat->RowData(r))[j] = RandGauss() * 1.5e+31;
4475  }
4476  }
4477 }

4480 template <class Real>
4481 static void UnitTestAddMatMatNans() {
4482  for (int32 i = 0; i < 200; i++) {
4483  int32 num_rows = RandInt(1, 256), mid = RandInt(1, 256), num_cols = RandInt(1, 256);
4484  Matrix<Real> mat1(num_rows, mid), mat2(mid, num_cols), prod(num_rows, num_cols);
4485  PlaceNansInGaps(&mat1);
4486  PlaceNansInGaps(&mat2);
4487  prod.AddMatMat(1.0, mat1, kNoTrans, mat2, kNoTrans, 0.0);
4488  // make sure the nan's don't propagate.
4489  KALDI_ASSERT(prod.Sum() == 0.0 &&
4490  "The BLAS library that you are linking against has an issue that might "
4491  "cause problems later on.");
4492  }

4495 template<class Real>
4496 static void UnitTestTopEigs() {
4497  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
4498  // Previously tested with this but takes too long.
4499  MatrixIndexT dim = 400, num_eigs = 100;
4500  SpMatrix<Real> mat(dim);
4501  for (MatrixIndexT i = 0; i < dim; i++)
4502  for (MatrixIndexT j = 0; j <= i; j++)
4503  mat(i, j) = RandGauss();
4504 
4505  Matrix<Real> P(dim, num_eigs);
4506  Vector<Real> s(num_eigs);
4507  mat.TopEigs(&s, &P);
4508  { // P should have orthogonal columns. Check this.
4509  SpMatrix<Real> S(num_eigs);
4510  S.AddMat2(1.0, P, kTrans, 0.0);
4511  KALDI_LOG << "Non-unit-ness of S is " << NonUnitness(S);
4512  KALDI_ASSERT(S.IsUnit(1.0e-04));
4513  }
4514  // Note: we call the matrix "mat" by the name "S" below.
4515  Matrix<Real> SP(dim, num_eigs); // diag of P^T SP should be eigs.
4516  SP.AddSpMat(1.0, mat, P, kNoTrans, 0.0);
4517  Matrix<Real> PSP(num_eigs, num_eigs);
4518  PSP.AddMatMat(1.0, P, kTrans, SP, kNoTrans, 0.0);
4519  Vector<Real> s2(num_eigs);
4520  s2.CopyDiagFromMat(PSP);
4521  AssertEqual(s, s2);
4522  // Now check that eigs are close to real top eigs.
4523  {
4524  Matrix<Real> fullP(dim, dim);
4525  Vector<Real> fulls(dim);
4526  mat.Eig(&fulls, &fullP);
4527  KALDI_LOG << "Approximate eigs are " << s;
4528  // find sum of largest-abs-value eigs.
4529  fulls.ApplyAbs();
4530  std::sort(fulls.Data(), fulls.Data() + dim);
4531  SubVector<Real> tmp(fulls, dim - num_eigs, num_eigs);
4532  KALDI_LOG << "abs(real eigs) are " << tmp;
4533  BaseFloat real_sum = tmp.Sum();
4534  s.ApplyAbs();
4535  BaseFloat approx_sum = s.Sum();
4536  KALDI_LOG << "real sum is " << real_sum << ", approx_sum = " << approx_sum;
4537  }
4538  }
4539 }

4541 template<typename Real> static void UnitTestTriVecSolver() {
4542  for (MatrixIndexT iter = 0; iter < 100; iter++) {
4543  int32 dim = 1 + Rand() % 20;
4544  Vector<Real> b(dim);
4545  b.SetRandn();
4546  TpMatrix<Real> T(dim);
4547  T.SetRandn();
4548 
4549  bool bad = false;
4550  for (int32 i = 0; i < dim; i++) {
4551  if (fabs(T(i, i)) < 0.2)
4552  bad = true;
4553  }
4554  if (bad) {
4555  // Test may fail due to almost-singular matrix.
4556  continue;
4557  }
4558 
4559  Vector<Real> x(b);
4560  MatrixTransposeType trans = (iter % 2 == 0 ? kTrans : kNoTrans);
4561  x.Solve(T, trans); // solve for T x = b
4562  Vector<Real> b2(dim);
4563  b2.AddTpVec((Real)1.0, T, trans, x, (Real)0.0);
4564  KALDI_LOG << "b is " << b << ", b2 is " << b2;
4565  AssertEqual(b, b2, 0.01);
4566  }
4567 }
